"Your opponent claims that there are tiny people inside the Braun tubes, explaining one thing after another, talking about the lives of these tiny people, what they look like, what type of magical power they have. ...And what do you do?"

"...Well, I study in a library and argue back by explaining how Braun tubes are constructed."

「この瞬間、法廷には、あなたの主張とあの子の主張が同時に存在する。……もしも、あの子の主張に耳を傾けたならば、それはあたかも真実に聞こえてしまうかもしれない。見えてしまうかもしれない。
"At this moment, both your claim and that child's claim exist in the court at the same time. ...If you find your opponent's claim convincing, it might sound like truth to you. It might look like truth to you.

~ib~あなたはまさにそれを見せつけられた~ib~。」
~ib~That is exactly what you saw~ib~."

「今この瞬間の六軒島には、確かに魔女も魔法も真実として存在するかもしれない。…しかしそれは、猫の箱が開かれる瞬間までの不確定な波動関数の世界。全ての状態が同時に説明できる。しかし、真実はひとつです。
"At this moment, on Rokkenjima, witches and magic certainly may exist as truth. ...However, until the moment that the cat's box is opened, that world is an uncertain wave function. The entire situation can be explained by both sides at the same time. However, there is one truth."

それは観測されることによって収縮し、無数の真実が淘汰されてたったひとつの真実になる。法廷で例えるならば、これは裁判長による判決行為にも似ているでしょう。検察側、弁護側がそれぞれに主張する２つの真実は、判決によって収縮し、１つとなるのです。」
"That set of truths shrinks with observation, and countless truths are weeded out to become one truth. It is like when, in court, the judge hands down his judgement. The two truths from the prosecutor's and the defense's claims...are reduced in number by the judgement and become one."

………相反する２つが同時に存在できる世界。そして相反する真実が、互いを否定する理由にできない世界。………理解できてきましたか…？」

しかしそれは、あの子の主張のひとつに過ぎないのです。あの子の如何なる主張も、あなたの主張する機会を拒むことはできない。……その意味において、この世界は双方にあまりに“公平”なのです。」

"......I...get it... ...Still, by that argument, if I show a sound argument with my `science theory', and it collides head on with her `magic theory', I also can't win against her. On top of that, the final judgement won't come until we peek into the Braun tube."

………この世界のブラウン管はどこにあるんだ。…俺たちに議論なんて必要ないってことになる。……俺たちは仲良くブラウン管の中身を覗けばいいだけの話じゃねぇのか？
"......Where is the Braun tube in this world? ...Because it exists, there should be no reason for us to argue. ...Why don't we just get along and peek into the Braun tube?"

中に小人が本当にいたら俺の全面敗北だ。いなかったら逆に俺の勝ち。……俺たちはブラウン管を覗かずに、どうして論争を繰り広げなくちゃならないんだ？」
"If there really is a tiny person in there, it's my complete loss. Otherwise, it's my victory. ...Why do we have to hold this debate without looking into the Braun tube?"

「それこそが、あの子があなたに挑んだ“ゲーム”なのです。裁判ではなく、チェスと例えるべきでしょう。勝敗は裁判官が決めるのではない。戦っているあなたたち自身が決めるのです。」

……親たちの思惑はともかく。
...Forget what the adults expected.

少なくとも俺たち子どもにとっては、いとこたちと親睦を深め合うだけの、楽しい二日間のはずだった。
At least for us kids, these were supposed to be a fun couple of days where the cousins deepened their friendship.

しかし、目が覚めてみれば、待ち受けていたのは信じ難いほどに残酷な現実だった…。
However, when we woke up, there was an unbelievably cruel reality waiting for us...

「…………ひっく、……えっく……！」
"......Hic, ...hic...!"

「………………………………。」
"............"

譲治の兄貴と朱志香は、それぞれ紗音ちゃんと嘉音くんの死に涙を零していた。
George-aniki and Jessica were crying over Shannon-chan and Kanon-kun's deaths.

……ゲストハウスの１階ロビーには、今、生きている全員が集まっていた。
その人数は、１２人。
...Right now, everyone who was alive had gathered in the lobby on the first floor of the guesthouse.

And there were 12 people there.

…信じられるだろうか？
昨日まで１８人いたんだ。
…その三分の一が、一夜にして、命を失った…。
...Unbelievable, right?

There were 18 until yesterday.

...And in one night, a third of that number had lost their lives...

俺は、ようやく興奮が醒めて、早朝に起こされた寝不足感が入り混じってきて、ほんの少し現実感を失いかけているところだった。
I eventually sobered up from my agitation and, along with my lack of sleep from being woken up so early in the morning, I was beginning to feel a faint sense of unreality.

……何かの悪い夢だと思いたい…。
...I want to think this is some kind of bad dream...

俺のチープな現実逃避は、さっきからそうであると延々と主張し続けている。
My cheap escapism keeps telling me that over and over.

真里亞は楼座叔母さんの座るソファーで、再び寝直してしまった。
…肝が据わっているというよりは、純粋に寝足りなかったのだろう。
Maria had gone back to sleep on the sofa Rosa was sitting in.

...Rather than her having nerves of steel, she probably genuinely hadn't had enough sleep.

大人たちは祖父さまのコレクションとかいう、ショートバレルのウィンチェスター銃をいじっていた。
The adults were holding items from what was apparently Grandfather's collection, short-barrel Winchester rifles.

…西部劇被れだった時代の名残らしく、そっくりな銃が４丁もあった。
...Apparently relics from a time he'd been obsessed with Westerns, there were four guns altogether.

それを蔵臼伯父さん、絵羽伯母さん、ウチの親父、楼座叔母さんの４兄弟で分ける。
Those had been split up among the four siblings: Uncle Krauss, Aunt Eva, my dad, and Aunt Rosa.

机の上には弾丸の詰まった紙箱が置かれ、４兄弟たちは黙々と弾丸を装填していた。
Paper boxes filled with bullets lay on the table, and the siblings were silently loading them.

「………何だか怖ぇや。こいつに触ってると、今でも親父に、触るな！って怒鳴られてぶん殴られるような気がするぜ。」
"......It's a little scary. Even now, touching one of these, I get the feeling Dad'll yell `Don't touch that!' and hit me."

「なら良かったな。…いくら触っても、もう殴られることはない。」
"Well, isn't that great? ...No matter how much you touch them, you won't be hit again."

「…………信じられないわ。…あのお父様が、
…………こんな最期を迎えるなんて…。」
"......I can't believe it. ...To think that Father...

......would meet this kind of end..."

「金蔵さんに限って、普通に床で亡くなるようなことはないだろうと思っていましたが、……それにしても、……惨すぎる…。」
"Well, I never did expect Kinzo-san to die normally in his bed, ...but even so, ...it is too horrible..."

「ねぇ。あれは本当にお父様なのかしら…？　私は、別人の死体で誤魔化した替え玉を疑ってるんだけど…。」
"Hey. I wonder if that really was Father...? I think it might be a different person's corpse, used as a substitute to trick us..."

「……いいえ、あれは間違いなくお父様です。足の指をご覧になったでしょう？　世間広しと言えど、両足の指が６本の人間はそうはいませんよ。」
"...No, it was Father, without a doubt. You saw his toes, right? Generally speaking, there aren't many humans with six toes on both feet."

「でも、…………いないとも言えない。多指症は珍しくない病気だと聞いたわ。大仕掛けの大好きな方なんでしょう？　……どこかで両足の指の数が自分と同じな遺体を手配したかもしれないわ。」
"But......that doesn't mean that such people don't exist. I've heard that polydactyly isn't that rare a disease. He was a man who liked large-scale tricks, right? ...He might have obtained a corpse from somewhere that had the same number of toes on both feet."

「馬鹿馬鹿しい。そんなこと、何のためにするというのですか…！」
"Ridiculous. Why would he do something like that...?!"

「……普通の人にならわしもそう言うわ。…しかしあのお父さんや。霧江さんの話も、まったくの荒唐無稽とは言い切れんのやないか。」
"...I'd agree if it was a normal person. ...But this is Father we're talkin' about. You can't be sure Kyrie-san's talkin' nonsense."

「…………焼死体は身元の確認が難しいという。
"......After all, burning a corpse makes it hard to identify.

だが、歯形とか骨格とか、色々調べる方法はあるはずさ。警察が調べれば、一発で身元なんかわかるに決まってる。」
Still, there should be a few ways to examine him from his teeth and bone structure. If the police investigated, of course they'd be able to know whose body it was right away."

「問題は、警察より先に電話技師が必要だという点だがね。」
"The problem...is that we need a telephone engineer more than the police right now."

「……この台風じゃ、船は来られないでしょうね。…なら、明日になるのかしら。」
"...The boats probably won't come in this typhoon. ...So, will they arrive tomorrow?"

「恐らく、明日の９時にもう一度船が来てくれるでしょう。そこで警察に連絡できると思います。」
"Most likely, the boat will come again at 9:00 tomorrow. Then, I believe we will be able to contact the police."

「……私たちも。そして犯人も。…つまりは台風が通り過ぎるまで、この島に閉じ込められたってわけね。」
"...It's the same for us...and the culprit. ...Until the typhoon passes, this island will be closed off."

………親たちの会話だけで、おおよその流れは理解できるだろうが、一応、状況を説明する。
......Just from our parents' conversation, you could probably figure out the general gist, but let's explain the situation anyway.

まず早朝。
First, early that morning.

祖父さまと使用人全員の合計６人の死体が、屋敷中の各所から相次いで見付かった。
In various places throughout the mansion, a total of six corpses, including Grandfather and all the servants, had been found one after another.

まず、祖父さまはボイラー室で火にくべられ丸焼けに。
First, Grandfather had been in the boiler room, completely burnt.

使用人たちは屋敷内のそれぞれの場所で、魔法陣の描かれた部屋に閉じ込められて死んでいた。
The servants had died, each shut up in the rooms throughout the mansion that had magic circles drawn on them.

使用人たちの死因は正確には不明だが、南條先生の見立てでは、槍のようなもので突かれたか、……もしくは銃で撃たれた可能性が高いという。
The cause of death for the servants was uncertain, but according to Doctor Nanjo's diagnosis, there was a high likelihood that they had been stabbed by something like a spear...or possibly shot with a gun.

大人たちがウィンチェスター銃で武装を始めたのはその為だ。
That was why the adults had started arming themselves with Winchesters.

さらに事態を混迷に追い込んだのは、電話が使用不能になっていたことだった。
落雷で故障したのか、犯人が破壊したのかはわからない。
And what made the situation even more chaotic...was the fact that the telephones had become unusable.

It was unknown if lightning had caused them to break down or if the culprit had broken them.

とにかく外部に連絡がつかず、警察へ連絡が取れなかった。
At any rate, since contact with the outside had been cut off, we couldn't reach the police.

つまり、台風が通り過ぎ、外から船が来てくれる明日の朝まで、自分たちで自衛をしなくてはならないのだ。
So until the typhoon passes and a boat comes tomorrow morning, we'll have to protect ourselves.

何しろ、今の六軒島は台風で隔絶されている。
俺たちが島に閉じ込められているように、犯人だって閉じ込められているのだから。
After all, Rokkenjima is now isolated by the typhoon.

And just as we're stuck on the island, so is the culprit.

大人たちは、昨夜まるまる徹夜して、屋敷の食堂で親族会議に明け暮れていたらしい。
そして事件は、にもかかわらず屋敷内で起こっている。
It seemed that the adults had stayed up all night, holding the family conference in the mansion's dining hall the whole time.

And yet, the crime had occurred in the mansion.

……つまり、大人たちがカネの話で大いに盛り上がっている真っ最中に、殺人犯は同じ屋根の下で殺人を犯していたわけだ…。
...So right when the adults had been in an uproar over money, the murderer had been killing under the same roof...

夏妃伯母さんは夜間の戸締りを厳重にさせていたという。
にもかかわらず、屋敷の中を不審者が出入りした。
They say Aunt Natsuhi's been strict about locking the doors and windows at the night.

And yet, some suspicious person had entered and left the mansion.

…大人たちは、屋敷内は広すぎて安全ではないと判断し、銃を引っ張り出して、俺たちのいるゲストハウスへ移動してきたのだ。
...The adults had decided that the inside of the mansion was too large to be safe, so they had pulled out the guns and moved to the guesthouse, where we had been.

………そして現在に至る。
......Which brings us to the present.

譲治の兄貴たちは、紗音ちゃんの遺体を一目みたいと懇願するが、大人たちは警察が来るまで駄目だと突っぱねる。
George-aniki had begged to see Shannon-chan's corpse, but the adults had refused, saying that he mustn't do so until the police arrived.

それは現場保全のために全ての部屋を封印したというだけの意味ではない。
That wasn't just because they wanted to seal all the rooms to preserve the scene.

…何しろ、６人も殺した犯人が徘徊した屋敷なのだ。
...After all, the culprit who had killed six people was wandering about the mansion.

今の右代宮家にとって、本宅であるはずの屋敷は、未知の殺人犯が出入りしている危険地帯も同然なのだ…。
To the Ushiromiya family right now, the mansion that should've been their home...was now a danger zone that an unknown murderer could enter and leave at will...

何しろ屋敷は広い。
死角や暗がりも多く、完全な安全を保証するには人数に対し広大過ぎた。
After all, it's a huge mansion.

There are plenty of blind spots and dark places, and it's too vast to guarantee absolute safety with this number of people.

そこへ行くと、ゲストハウスは屋敷に比べればはるかに小さい建物だ。
Relatively speaking, the guesthouse was much smaller.

地上２階建て。部屋数は１０ちょっとくらい？
……元々、この島のリゾート化を見越して、ペンションにするために建てたらしい。
It had two above-ground stories. Something like 10 or so rooms?

...Apparently, it had originally been constructed to serve as a small hotel, as part of the plan to turn this island into a resort.

だから全体の把握がしやすく、安全も確保しやすい。篭城に向くというわけだ。
So, it was easier to know what was going on everywhere inside it, and it'd be easier to keep safe. It made for a good place to hole up in.

……そして。
この６人もの大量殺人が、“ゲーム”である可能性が極めて高い。
...Also...

...It was extremely likely that this mass murder of six people was a `game'.

犯人がそれを、手紙にて宣言してきたからだ。
After all, the culprit had proclaimed so in a letter.

真里亞が昨日、ベアトリーチェにもらったと自称したのと同じ、紋章入りの洋形封筒が、祖父さまの死体が発見されたボイラー室内で見付かったという。
I heard that a Western-style envelope with the family crest, just like the one Maria claimed to have received from Beatrice yesterday, had been found in the boiler room where Grandfather's corpse had been discovered.

その手紙の中身はこうだった。
This was what the letter said.

誤解なきように。
私が求めるゲームは、皆さんが碑文の謎を解けるかどうかであって、私を捕まえられるかどうかではありません。
So that there will be no misunderstandings...

The game I seek is for everyone to try and solve the riddle of the epitaph, not for you to try and catch me.

碑文の謎を解かなければ、哀れな生贄はさらに増えるでしょう。
時間は、私の姿を探すより、碑文の謎解きに割いた方が賢明です。
If you don’t solve the riddle, the pitiful sacrifices will further increase in number.

It would be wiser to spend your time solving the epitaph, instead of searching for me.

碑文の謎が誰にも解けないならば、誰も生き残れない。
If no one can solve the riddle, no one will survive.

見事、碑文の謎を解けた人間が現れたなら、黄金郷の全ての黄金を与え、右代宮家の家督と、我が力の全てを与えるでしょう。
If a person appears who can miraculously solve it, I will give them all the gold of the Golden Land, the Ushiromiya Family Headship, and all of my power.

金蔵さまより右代宮家の家督を引き継いだのは、私。
そして、私より家督を引き継ぐのは誰なのか、楽しみにしています。
I was the one who succeeded the Ushiromiya Family Headship after Kinzo-sama.

I look forward to seeing who will succeed to that headship after me.

——黄金の魔女　ベアトリーチェ。
——The Golden Witch, Beatrice.

…碑文の謎ってのは、例のアレだ。
...This riddle of the epitaph was...that thing.

屋敷の大広間に掲げられた魔女の肖像画のところに書いてある怪しげな碑文。
That strange epitaph written by the portrait of the witch on display in the hall of the mansion.

祖父さまが書かせたもので、それを解いた者に家督を譲るとか、隠された黄金を譲るとか騒がせた例のアレだ。
Grandfather was the one who had it written, and the person who solved it would, supposedly, be given the inheritance or the hidden gold or something like that.

何年か前に掲げられて以来、親族たちは口では馬鹿にしながらも、影ではこっそりその謎に挑戦していたという。
Ever since it was first put on display there several years ago, the relatives had secretly tried to solve that riddle, despite saying on the surface that the whole idea was silly.

しかし、誰も解けずに今日に至っている。
その難解な謎を、解いてみろと再び突きつけ、しかも解けなければ皆殺しだと脅迫している。
However, up until today, no one had solved it.

We were once again being urged to solve that unintelligible riddle, and this time, we were faced with the threat that we'd all be killed if we didn't solve it.

……これを“ゲーム”と言わずして何というのか…。
...If that wasn't a `game', what else could it be...?

敷地内を捜索して犯人を探し出そうという勇ましい意見も、一度は出た。
The bold opinion that we should search the premises for the culprit did come up once.

しかし、向こうは武装している可能性が高い上、しかもひとりとは限らない。
However, there was a good chance they were armed, and there might not be just one of them.

また、…彼らは６人以上を殺せたかもしれない
And, ...while they might have been able to kill more than six people, they had

のに、それを~ib~６人に留めた~ib~。
~ib~stopped at 6~ib~.

犯人を迂闊に刺激せず、大人しく警察の到着を待って安全地帯で篭城すべきだという意見が、最終的には支配したのだった…。
The opinion that won out in the end...was that we should avoid needlessly antagonizing the culprit, and hole up in a safe place while we waited for the police to arrive...

大人たちは、ゲストハウス内の戸締りを厳重に確認した後、このロビーを砦に見立てる。
After the adults carefully checked that the doors and windows in the guesthouse were locked, they set up camp in the lobby.

そして銃を弄って緊張を紛らわしながら、まだまだ始まったばかりの長い一日に、早くも疲労の表情を見せるのだった…。
As they loaded their guns to distract themselves from the tension, their expressions showed that they were already fatigued from this long day, which had still barely begun...

俺には、何もできることはない。
There was nothing for me to do.

もし万が一、…~ib~銃が余るようなこと~ib~が起こった際に備え、銃の使い方を教えてもらうことくらいしか、今はできない……。
Now, all I could do was be taught how to use a gun, to prepare for the off-chance of something happening that ~ib~led to an excess of guns~ib~...

……それでいい。
...That's fine.

そこで大人しくしててくれよ、~ib~俺たち~ib~。
Just obediently stay there, ~ib~me and the rest of you~ib~.

「……………また、最初は６人か。しかも今回は祖父さまと使用人が全部まとめてと来たもんだ。」
"......Six people in the beginning again. And this time it's Grandfather and all of the servants put together."

「恐らく。あの子は前回のゲームでのあなたの指し手を慎重に研究したのでしょう。そしてあなたが最初に疑うと高い確率で推定される駒を、最優先で奪ったに違いありませんよ。」
"Most likely, that child has carefully studied your moves from the last game...and has made an optimal move by taking the pieces you were most likely to suspect from the start."

「……筋だな。…前回も前々回も。屋敷に精通し、マスターキーを持ち歩く使用人たち全員は、常に最高順位で疑わしい人物だった。
"...That makes sense. ...That was true both last time and the time before that. The servants, who know everything about the mansion and who walk around with keys, always fall into the most suspicious category of people."

……前回のゲームの、例えば朱志香の密室がいい例だ。使用人が犯人であることを認めさえすれば、あんなのは密室でも何でもない。」
"...A good example in the last game would be Jessica's closed room. If I'd only accepted that a servant was the culprit, that wouldn't even have been a closed room."

「故に。……あの子はそこを真っ先に切りに来た。あなたがやがて逃げ込むであろう退路を、真っ先に塞ぎに来たのでしょう。」
"And so, ...that child went straight for them, probably to block off a method of escape you'd be likely to attempt sooner or later."

「ベアトはすでに赤で、この島には１９人以上いないと宣言している。
"Beato already proclaimed in red that there are no more than 18 people on this island.

…それはつまり、
………~ib~諦めろってことだ~ib~。
...In other words,

...~ib~it's time to give up on that~ib~.

……もう俺は、１８人の誰かを疑わざるを得ない。」
...Now I've got to suspect one of the 18."

「……あの子は、その１８人の駒を全て奪いきった上で、存在しないはずの１９人目として降臨し、あなたに自らが魔女であることを認めさせる手で来るでしょう。……魔法を見せ付けることで強引に屈服させる、恫喝的手法がもはや通じない以上、あの子に指せるのは正攻法だけなのですから。」
"...That child will probably come at you by stealing the pieces for all the 18, ...while also making an appearance as a 19th person who shouldn't exist, for then you would be forced to accept that your opponent is a witch. ...After all, now that the intimidation approach has failed, trying to force you to surrender by showing you magic, the only remaining option is a frontal attack."

「……上等だ。もうハッタリは通用しねぇぜ。」
"...Perfect. Bluffing won't work anymore."

「気をつけて。まやかしは魔女のもっとも得意とするところ。…あの子が何を言おうと何を見せようと。あなたが信じる真実を、決して脅かすことなどできないのです。それを忘れないで。」
"Be careful. Deception is what witches are best at. ...No matter what your opponent says or shows you, it will not be able to threaten the truth that you believe in. Don't forget that."

「………おう。そう何度も同じ手が通用して堪るかってんだ。
"......Sure. As if I'd fall for the same moves over and over.

………出て来いよ、ベアトリーチェ。おッ始めようぜッ！！！」
......Come on out, Beatrice. Let's get started!!!"

「すでに勝負のテーブルに着席しておるわ。妾の手番もすでに終了しておる。」
"I am already seated at the table of the contest. And my turn is already complete."

「……マダムを敵に回すことになるとは。厄介ですね、お嬢様。…手の内をだいぶ読まれますよ。」
"...To think we would end up having Madam as our foe. This will not be easy, Milady. ...Our moves will be read thoroughly."

「構わん。お師匠様の指し手など、すでに時代遅れの古典よ。恐れるに足りぬわ。」
"I care not. By now, Teacher's moves are all old-fashioned classics. There is nothing to fear."

「…あなたが、私の教えた古典以上の何を指せるのか。期待していますよ、ベアトリーチェ？」
"...So, just what moves can you make beyond the classics I taught you? I look forward to seeing, Beatrice."

「……くっくくくくくく。いいのか、戦人ぁ？　魔女を否定するそなたが魔女を軍師につけても…。」
"...*cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle* You okay with this, Battleer? Can someone who denies witches really accept a witch as a strategist...?"

「下らねぇ挑発は無用だ。こいつは俺の相談役、いや、セコンドだ。
"Your stupid provocation is pointless. This is my advisor...no, my second.

ガチンコで殴りあうのは、俺とお前だってことには何の変化もない。」
That doesn't change one bit...that this is a fistfight between you and me."

「わかっておる。……ヨチヨチのお前には自転車にも補助輪が必要だろう。好きにするが良い。
"I understand. ...One as wobbly as yourself probably needs training wheels on his bicycle. Do as you like.

さぁ、始めろ！！　お前の手番だッ！」
Come, let us begin!! It's your turn!"

「事件現場の再構築から始める。……ワルギリア、さっそく頼む！」
"Let's begin with the reconstruction of the crime scene. ...Virgilia, quickly please!"

「最初の遺体発見は紗音から。屋敷内の１階客間より発見されました。扉と窓は施錠され、密室を構成していました。」
"The first corpse discovered was Shannon's. She was found in the parlor on the first floor of the mansion. The door and windows were locked, and a closed room was established."

「……ベアトに説明要求。密室の定義を再確認。」
"...Beato, I need some details. Let's reconfirm the definition of a closed room."

「ふむ。密室の定義は、内外の出入りが一切隔絶された室内を指す。当然、内外からの一切の侵入・脱出は愚か、干渉もできない。それは包括的に、隠し扉の否定、外部干渉の余地一切の否定を含む。
"Indeed. The term `closed room' refers to a room where the inside and the outside are completely cut off from each other. Naturally, it will be impossible to even affect things across that boundary line, much less enter or escape across it. This includes an all-inclusive denial of the existence of hidden doors, as well as all possibility of intervention from the outside.

...No, she probably could've countered it, but for some strategic reason, she admitted defeat.

勝ったというよりは、あと一歩のところで逃げられた、という気持ちの方が強い…。
It felt less like I'd won...and more like I'd let her slip away at the last second...

魔女とのチェスは、説明不要のＸという駒だけで戦いを進められる。
In a chess match with a witch, battles can be fought solely with pieces known as X, which require no detailed explanations.

“悪魔の証明”のお陰で、俺はいくつでもおかしな架空を生み出し、議論を戦わせることができるわけだ。
Thanks to the `Devil's Proof', I could create as many strange fictions as I wanted and use them as fighters in our argument.

…しかしそれは、魔女とのチェスにおいてだけの話だ。
……俺たち人間の世界では、そんな抽象的な話では物事は説明できない。
...But that only works in a chess match with a witch.

...In our human world, you can't use such abstract theories to explain things.

今回の第一の晩の６つの連鎖密室。
…確かに人間には可能かもしれない。
This first twilight was a chain of six closed rooms.

...It certainly may have been possible for a human.

ベアトはそれを全て否定はしきれなかった。
Beato wasn't able to deny all possibilities.

しかし、誰が、何の為に、そして実際にはどうやって犯行に及んだのか、さっぱり見当も付かない…。
However, I don't have a clue who committed the crime, or why, or how they actually did it...

勝っておいて何だが。
……いっそ、人間には不可能だと、ベアトリーチェに言い切られた方がなぜかすっきりしたような気がした。
It may seem strange to hear me saying this after I won...

...But for some reason, I felt like I'd have been more satisfied if Beatrice had been able to say definitively that it was impossible for humans.

俺はＸなどという抽象的な駒で誤魔化すが。
…………何か、知ってはならない不気味な意思が、…確かにこの屋敷の中には満ちていることを否定できないのだ…。
I managed to avoid specifics using an abstract piece called X...

......But I couldn't deny the sense that some eerie intent that must never be known...was filling up this entire mansion...

篭城の真の敵は、姿の見えぬ犯人への恐怖より、それを延々と持続させることができるかどうかの方かもしれない。
When being beseiged, your true enemy isn't so much the fear of an unseen culprit...as it is keeping such fears alive for long periods of time.

真里亞は退屈なのでテレビを見たいと騒ぎ出す。
テレビはロビーにないため、２階のいとこ部屋へ戻ることにした。
Maria got bored and started complaining that she wanted to watch TV.

There was no TV in the lobby, so she decided to return to the cousin room on the second floor.

真里亞だけをひとりぼっちにしたくない思惑もあるのだろう。
大人たちは、子どもは全員、２階のいとこ部屋にいるようにと言い渡した。
The adults probably wanted to make sure Maria wasn't left on her own...

They told all the children to go to the second floor cousin room.

婚約者を失い傷心した譲治は、それに抗う気力もなく、いとこたちを率いて２階に上がった。
George, who was grief-stricken by the loss of his fiancée, led the cousins up to the second floor without any resistance.

南條は初め、ロビーで本を読んでいたが、親族たちが内々にキナ臭い話をしたがっているらしい様子を察知すると、「お邪魔なようですな…」と言い残し、２階の自分の部屋へ戻っていった。
At first, Nanjo had been reading a book in the lobby, but when he noticed the relatives looking like they wanted to discuss something sinister, he said `It seems I am in the way...' and returned to his room on the second floor.

「………腹ぁ、減ったな。ぼんやりしてると、それ以上に眠気が来るぜ。」
"......I'm starving. And if we just keep sitting around, we'll get sleepy too."

「無理もないわよ。私たちは昨夜、寝てないんだから。」
"It's only natural. We didn't get any sleep at all last night."

「…きっちり２４時間をここで篭城することになるだろう。無理をせず交代で仮眠する方が賢明かもしれんね。」
"...We will probably end up being barricaded here for a full 24 hours. It may be wiser to take naps in turn instead of over-stressing ourselves."

「そうですね。私と主人がここにおりますので、辛い方は無理せずお休みになって下さい。」
"True. My husband and I will remain here, so I ask that anyone having trouble staying awake take it easy and rest."

「相手はそれを期待してるかもしれないわよ？　この人数では崩せなくても、いくらか減ったら、その隙を突いて来るつもりかも。」
"Our opponent might be expecting that, right? Even if they couldn't defeat this many people, if that number shrinks enough, they may plan to use that moment to strike."

「ここには７人いるわ。２人ずつ交代で３時間くらい休むとか。……明日の朝は遠いわよ。今はまだ体力があるからいいけど、今夜は辛そうね。」
"There are seven of us here, so we could take three-hour shifts in pairs. ...Tomorrow morning's a long way off. We still have some energy now, but tonight's going to be tough."

「そやな。眠いもんはおるか？　無理せんと休んでや。」
"Sure will. Anyone sleepy? Don't overdo it, and get some rest."

秀吉が、先に寝たいのは誰かと一同を見回すが、立候補者はいなかった。
Hideyoshi looked around at everyone to see who wanted to sleep first, but no one volunteered.

…皆、眠いのは同じだが、今すぐ寝られるほどの豪胆さはない。
……眠いのと同じくらいに、未知の犯人への恐れがあるのだ。
...Everyone was just as tired, but no one was bold enough to go to sleep right away.

...Their fear of the unknown culprit was just as strong as their sleepiness.

「……おらんかいな。ま、みんな、無理はせんでな。」
"...Nobody? Well, don't overdo it, everyone."

「眠くなったらその時に考えるわ。……確かに眠いけど、今はそういう気分じゃないの。」
"If we get tired, we'll deal with it then. ...I'll admit I'm sleepy, but I'm not in the mood now."

絵羽はそう鋭く言うと、ボイラー室で見付かったベアトリーチェからの２通目の手紙を読み返した。
As Eva spoke sharply, she reread the second letter from Beatrice, which had been found in the boiler room.

ベアトリーチェは２通もの手紙を送りつけ、繰り返し、碑文の謎を解いてみろと催促している。
Beatrice had sent them two letters, which had repeatedly told them to solve the riddle of the epitaph.

そして、解ければ財産も家督も全て譲るとまで挑発している…。
And she'd even provoked them by saying she'd give up her assets and the Headship if they could solve it...

絵羽は、手帳を取り出すと、碑文を写したページを開いた。
Eva took out a notebook and opened it to a page with the epitaph copied onto it.

「…………例の碑文、ですか？」
"......Is this that epitaph?"

「えぇ。……犯人の言いなりになるのは癪だけど。どうせ時間は腐るほどあるわ。退屈凌ぎには丁度いいと思って。」
"Yes. ...I hate doing what the culprit says, but we do have time to waste. I think it's the perfect way to stave off boredom."

「…悪くない時間潰しだ。兄弟で仲良く挑戦してみようじゃないか。」
"...Not a bad way to kill time. Why don't we challenge it together as siblings?"

「……借りてもいいかしら？　もう少し大きく書き直すわ。
"...Can I borrow that? I'll rewrite it just a little larger.

夏妃さん、もう少し大きな紙はないですか？」
Natsuhi-san, do you have a slightly larger piece of paper?"

「使用人室に紙くらいあるでしょう。取ってきます。」
"There should be paper in the servant room. I will bring some."

すぐに夏妃は、使用人室からＢ４ほどの無地の紙を持ってきた。
Natsuhi immediately brought a blank B4 sheet of paper from the servant room.

霧江は絵羽の手帳を借りると、そこに碑文を書き出し、テーブルの上に置いた。
Kyrie borrowed Eva's notebook, wrote out the epitaph on the paper, and laid it out on the table.

それを一同はさっそく覗き込む。
…自然と人垣が出来た。
Then, everyone quickly peered down at it.

...They automatically formed a crowd.

「話には聞いとったが。…こらぁ、難儀な謎やなぁ。何を言っとるのか、さっぱりや。」
"I've heard about it, ...but, really, this is a tough riddle. I don't have a clue what it's talkin' about."

「私も一時、がんばって挑戦したんだけれど、同じくさっぱりだったわ。」
"At one point, I also did my best to solve it, but I was just as clueless."

「わかってたら、のこのこと金策には来ねぇさ。何しろ１０ｔの黄金だからな。」
"If you did know, you wouldn't have come all the way out here with a plan to make money. After all, it's 10 tons of gold we're talking about."

「…………真面目に読むのは初めてなんだけど。……大雑把に言って、３部分に分かれてるのかしら？」
"......This is the first time I've read through it seriously, but...roughly speaking, couldn't it be split into three parts?"

「…昨夜から思っているが、霧江さんはだいぶ頭が切れるようだ。ひょっとすると、私らでは解けなかった謎を、いとも簡単に解いてしまうかもしれんね。」
"...I've been thinking this since last night, but you really are a good thinker, Kyrie-san. Perhaps you'll be able to easily solve this riddle that we couldn't."

「あぁ。霧江は鋭いぜ。……変な先入観を与えない方が、面白い捉え方を出来るかもしれないな。」
"Yeah. Kyrie's sharp. ...She might find a more interesting take on it if she comes in without any confusing biases."

「………そうね。霧江さん。率直に、この碑文を読んだ感想を聞かせてくれないかしら。」
"......That's right. Kyrie-san, would you mind giving us your honest opinion after reading the epitaph?"

「多分、皆さんのお役には立てないと思うわ。みんな買い被りすぎよ。」
"I doubt you'll find it useful. You all give me too much credit."

「いやいや、思いつきや適当でいいんだ。お前の話を聞かせてくれ。
"That's fine, just say whatever comes into your head. Let's hear your thoughts.

……俺が悩んだ時は、いつだってお前のヒントが助けてくれたんだからな。」
...The hints you give always help me out when I'm worried."

「あら、役に立ってたのね。今更だけど嬉しいわ。」
"Oh, so I have been helpful? It's nice to finally hear about this now."

「よせやぃ、いつも感謝してるぜ？」
"Come ooon, don't I always thank you?"

「仲がいいのね。羨ましいわ。」
"You two sure are close. I'm jealous."

「ぜひ私たちにもヒントを授けてほしいわ。いいのよ、どうせ時間潰しなんだから、リラックスして？」
"And the rest of us would also love to hear these hints of yours. We're just killing time anyway, so relax, okay?"

霧江は、妙なところで祭り上げられてしまったと困惑する。
Kyrie was disturbed at being praised so highly for something so strange.

…だが、時間はいくらでもあるのだ。
これがある種の暇潰しであることを理解し、その役を買って出ることにする…。
...But they had all the time in the world.

Realizing that this was just a way to waste time, she decided to accept the role she'd been given...

「……きっと見当外れなことを言っちゃうと思うけど、…じゃあ、私の考えで進めてみるわね。」
"...I'm sure I'll say something off the mark, but...well, I'll put forward my ideas."

「うむ。……最初に言った、大雑把に言って３部分に分かれる、とはどういう意味かね？」
"Indeed. ...What did you mean in the beginning, about how it could be divided into three parts, roughly speaking?"

えっと、…そのままの意味よ。
碑文は大体、３つのパーツに分けることができると思うの。
Well, ...I just mean what I said.

I think that overall, the epitaph can be divided into three sections.

まず最初の“そこに黄金の鍵が眠る”までの５行。
ここまでが鍵の在り処を示した最初の部分。
First, there are the five lines up until `There sleeps the key to the gold'.

Up until this point is the first part, which directs you to the location of the key.

そして第十の晩までの１１行が、黄金郷そのものの場所を示した部分。
And then there's the part formed by the 11 lines up until the tenth twilight, which refer to the location of the Golden Land itself.

そして残りの６行は、黄金郷に辿り着いてからの部分ね。
And the remaining six lines make up the part after the Golden Land has been reached.

「そうですね。鍵と、黄金郷。そして黄金郷の宝の話の３つに区分けできますね。」
"I see. It can be divided into three parts about the key, the Golden Land, and the Golden Land's treasure."

「その程度なら、我々だって把握しているさ。鍵と扉、そして宝を示す３つの区分だ。」
"Even we have been able to grasp that much. The three sections that refer to the key, the door, and the treasure."

「…兄さん、余計な口を挟まないで！　霧江さんに自由な発想で発言してもらうのよ。」
"...Nii-san, don't butt in any more than you have to! Let Kyrie-san speak her ideas freely."

「霧江。続けてくれ。……俺たちもそれについては同じ認識だ。それで？」
"Kyrie, please continue. ...We see it the same way you do so far. So then?"

「……最初に出てくる“懐かしき故郷”というのはどういう意味なのかしら。普通に考えたら、お祖父さまの故郷を指すのかしら？　懐かしきとわざわざ断るところを見ると、とても思い入れのある故郷のように思えるわね。……お父さんは小田原の出身だったかしら？」
"...I wonder about the meaning of that thing in the beginning, the `beloved hometown'. Normally, that would refer to where Grandfather lived, right? Since Father went to all the trouble of telling us that it's beloved, we can imagine that it's a hometown he had strong feelings for. ...Did Father come from Odawara?"

「………生まれは確かに小田原だけど、お父様が懐かしむ故郷は、多分、小田原のことじゃないわ。それについては、多分、兄弟たちは全員、同じ場所で認識してるわね。」
"......Odawara is definitely where he was born, but I don't think that's the hometown he loved. I imagine all of us siblings have the same place in mind."

「…そうね。多分、小田原じゃないわね。聞いた話では、とても楽しい少年時代だったそうよ。」
"...Right. This probably isn't Odawara. From what I've heard, he had a very fun time as a youth."

「はっはは。…親父の人生で最大の不幸は多分、右代宮家の当主にさせられたことだろうよ。」
"Hahhaha. ...Being made the Ushiromiya Family Head was probably Dad's greatest bit of misfortune in life."

「……恐らくな。親父殿は右代宮家の当主になど、本当はなりたくなかったのだ。」
"...Probably. Father didn't actually want to become the Head."

「それはどこなのかしら？　そしてそこに鮎の泳ぐ川は？」
"So where is this place? Is there a river there where sweetfish swim?"

「……当時はあったんじゃないかしら。今はだいぶ開発が進んだでしょうから、鮎はいなくなってるかもしれない。お祖父さまが少年時代の当時に鮎がいた、と言われると非常に調べるのは困難ね。」
"...Maybe there was at the time. There's been a lot of development there since then, and the sweetfish might have disappeared. It would be extremely difficult to investigate whether sweetfish were there during Grandfather's boyhood years."

「川も一本ではないだろう。地理的な意味では我々もそれぞれにかなり調べたつもりだ。
"And there probably isn't just a single river. I believe we all gave this a thorough investigation geographically.

……絵羽に至っては、現地まで直接調べに行ったんじゃないかね？」
...You even went to the actual place to investigate directly, right, Eva?"

「あくまでも旅行としてよ。……でも、町並みは当時と完全に変わってる。何しろ戦争を挟んでるのよ？　お父様がどこに住んでいたのかさえ、正確な場所の把握は不可能よ。…多分、お父様が自ら現地へ足を運んでも、今となっては、どこに住んでいたか特定できないでしょうね。」
"That was only as a vacation. ...But, the townscape had changed completely since Father's time. After all, it was caught up in that war, wasn't it? By now, even precisely locating the place Father lived is impossible. ...I imagine that if Father went there himself now, even he wouldn't be able to pick out the place he'd lived anymore."

「あちらさんもずいぶん目覚しく復興したって話だからな…。」
"Well, after all, those guys have also gone through a remarkable recovery..."

「…………鮎の川、と言われて、はっきりとした地名は出ないの？」
"......Does the part about a sweetfish river bring any place name clearly to mind?"

「そりゃあなぁ。何しろ、鮎だぜ？　水が綺麗な川に住むってんだから、それこそ心当たりの川は無数だったろうさ。親父が無邪気に鮎釣りをした小川も、その後の開発で埋められたりもしただろう。戦前の地図、もしくは戦前の現地に詳しい人でもいりゃあ話は別だが…。」
"Well, yeah. After all, they're sweetfish, right? People say they live in rivers with clean water, so there are countless rivers that might work. Any stream Dad innocently went sweetfish-fishing in was probably buried by the development later. It'd be different if we had a map from before the war or a person who knew a lot about how the area was before the war, but..."

「……多分、そういう話ではないわ。」
"...It probably isn't something like that."

「どういうことだね…？」
"What do you mean...?"

「………懐かしき、故郷を貫く鮎の川。黄金郷を目指す者よ、これを下りて鍵を探せ。…ここまでの２行で、一度改行してるのよね。…この２行だけで、何かの提示が成立するのよ。その何かに基づいて次の３行が続くんじゃないかしら。」
"...Behold the sweetfish river running through my beloved hometown. You who seek the Golden Land, follow its path downstream in search of the key. ...After these two lines, there's a single blank line. ...Something is being presented with just these two lines. What if the next three lines continue based upon that something?"

「何かの提示って何やろな…？」
"What do you mean, something is being presented...?"

「……わからないわ。とにかくその２行だけで、どの川かわからないとか、そんなあやふやじゃなくて。はっきりとこの“川”という特定ができるのよ。
"...I don't know. At any rate, what we can get from these two lines alone isn't something vague, like the question of which river it might be, but the clear presentation of the keyword `river'."

……ひょっとすると、水の流れる“川”ではないかもしれないわね。…“鮎の川”は何かの比喩かもしれない。……鮎という言葉にはどんなイメージがあるのかしら。」
"...It may be that this isn't a `river' with water flowing down it. ...The `sweetfish river' might be some kind of metaphor. ...What sort of impressions does the word `sweetfish' give?"

「………鮎はシャケみたいなモンや。淡水魚だが、生まれてすぐは海に出るんや。そして大きくなると川に戻ってきて生活し、そこに産卵して生涯を終えるんや。
"......Sweetfish are like salmon. They're freshwater fish, but they go out into the ocean right after they're born. When they get big, they go back to the river to live there, and then they spawn there and end their lives there.

ま、一度は家を出るが、大きくなって戻ってきて卵を産むってな辺りは、一族繁栄的なイメージがあるかもしれんな。」
Well, they leave their home at one point, but when they get big, they come back and lay eggs. Might be able to link that to the idea of clan prosperity."

「へー。淡水魚なのに海水でも生きられるのかよ。知らなかったぜ。川魚だから海には出られないと思ってたぜ。」
"Oh? They're freshwater fish, but they can live in the ocean? I didn't know that. I figured river fish wouldn't be able to live in the sea."

「鮎は香りが良いことから香魚とも呼ばれるとか。私は食べたことがありませんが、塩焼きにするととてもおいしいそうですよ。」
"And they are called sweetfish because they have a pleasant aroma. I have never eaten one, but I have heard they can be quite delicious when grilled with salt."

「なんや、夏妃さん！　鮎の塩焼き、食ったことあらへんのか！　うまいでぇ！　今度、ご馳走したるわ！」
"What's that, Natsuhi-san?! You've never eaten salt-grilled sweetfish?! They're delicious! You should try it sometime soon!"

「庶民の料理だ。君の口には相応しくない。」
"It is a food for commoners. Hardly appropriate for your mouth."

「……これは私の妄想なんだけど。…実は私、鮎の川のイメージから、家系図を疑ったことがあるの。鮎は一度海へ出るけど、また生まれた川に帰ってきて産卵するんでしょう？　………まるで私のことみたいだなって思って。」
"...This is just my wild idea, ...but the impression I get from a sweetfish river makes me suspect a family tree. The sweetfish go out into the ocean for a time, but they return to the river where they were born to spawn, right? ......It reminds me of myself."

「……そうね。今だから白状するけど、私もあなたと真里亞ちゃんのことを指してるんじゃないかって疑ったことがあるわ。」
"You're right. By this point, I can confess that I've sometimes suspected that it refers to you and Maria-chan."

「なるほど。……川を下れば、やがて里あり。家系図を下ってくと見付かる“里”は、真里亞の名に含まれる“里”の字だけだ。」
"I see. ...As you travel down the river, you will see a village. If you go down the family tree, all you find is Maria's name (真里亞). Only her name has a `里' (read `ri' or `sato'), the character Father uses for village here."

「でしょう？！　……でも、みんなも知っての通り、お父様は真里亞のことを毛嫌いしてて、ほとんど言葉を交わしたこともない。
"Isn't that right?! ...But as you all know, Father doesn't like Maria, and he almost never speaks with her.

それに、お父様はかつて真里亞に全然違う名前をつけるように言っていたの。それを私が勝手に真里亞にした。お父様はそれをとても怒っていたわ。……その経緯を考えると、財産や家督を引き継ごうという大切な碑文に、真里亞の名を引用するとはとても思えなくて。」
And, in the past, Father told me to give Maria a completely different name. I just decided to go with Maria on my own. Father was very mad about that. ...Given that, it's very hard to imagine that he would reference Maria's name in his precious epitaph about who would succeed his wealth and inheritance."

「真里亞ちゃんに碑文を読ませたことは？」
"Have you ever let Maria-chan read the epitaph?"

「え、えぇ。もちろんあるわ。でも、さっぱりみたいだった。……魔女の復活の儀式、みたいな相変わらずのオカルト話ばかりで、さっぱりだったわ。」
"Uh, yes, of course. But she seemed to have no idea what the answer was. ...She didn't have a clue, and she kept going on about that same occult stuff, about how it was a resurrection ceremony for the witch."

「…………親父殿と真里亞の接点。…確かに両者にオカルト趣味はあるが、まったく交流はなかった。…私も、真里亞のことを指しているとは思えんね。」
"......A connection between Father and Maria. ...Certainly, they do share that occult hobby, but they never interacted. ...I can't imagine it that refers to Maria either."

「……懐かしき、とわざわざ冒頭に付けているのが私は気になるわ。……さっきみんなが言っていたように、お父さんにとって右代宮家の当主となることが不本意だったとしたなら。それを懐かしんだりするかしら。…それは右代宮本家を示す小田原ではないと思うの。
"...What sticks out to me is how he went out of his way to add `beloved' to that first line. ...Like you all said just now, if Father was reluctant about becoming the Ushiromiya Family Head, would he have fond memories for anything connected to that? ...I don't think this can be Odawara, which represents the Ushiromiya Head Family."

……私には、この“懐かしき”という冒頭の一語が、お父様にとってとても大切な思い出深い場所を示しているに違いないと信じているんだけれど。」
"...I believe this word `beloved' here at the beginning...must refer to a place full of very important memories to Father."

「……………ふーむ。…まぁいいさ。当時の地図もさっぱりだから特定は困難だが、とにかく、親父の少年時代の故郷に鮎が泳げる川は何本かあったろうさ。」
"......Hmmmmmm. ...Well, that's fine. It would be hard to pinpoint since we don't have even a trace of a map from that time, but at any rate, there were probably several rivers with sweetfish swimming in them near Dad's hometown during his youth."

「水の流れる川なら、ね？
"That's if we're looking for a river with water flowing down it, right?

それから？　続けてよ霧江さん。」
And then? Go on, Kyrie-san."

「……川を下ればやがて里あり、からの３行はちょっとよくわからないわ。…これは多分、鮎の川の２行に連結してる。鮎の川の正体がわかれば、多分、自然と意味が繋がるものなのよ。…それがわからない限り、この３行を先に解こうとしても無駄でしょうね。」
"...I don't really understand the three lines starting with `As you travel down it, you will see a village'. ...It's probably linked to the two lines about the sweetfish river. I imagine it's something we'd understand automatically if we knew what the sweetfish river really was. ...Until we figure that out, it's probably useless to try and solve those three lines any further."

「“鮎の川”の正体がわからねぇとお手上げか…。しかも文字通り、河川を指した保証もねぇと来た。
"So we're stuck unless we know what the `sweetfish river' really is... And there's no guarantee it even means a literal river.

…ったく。鮎ってのは何なんだ？　親父の好物か？　それとも何か特別な意味があるのか？　深読みしても仕方ねぇのか？」
...Seriously. What's up with the sweetfish? Did Dad like to eat them? Or does it have some special meaning? Is it pointless to read too deeply into it?"

「…ミクロとマクロの２つの視点を持たないと、視野が狭まるわね。……深く考えすぎないで、魚が泳いでる川、あるいは流れ、
…下るもの、上るもの、そのくらいの抽象的なイメージにしておいた方が発想が柔軟になっていいかもしれないわ。」
"...If you don't have both a micro and a macro perspective, your field of vision grows narrow. ...It might be better to be flexible and avoid thinking too deeply, focusing on an abstract image of a river where fish swim, or something that can flow...

up or down."

「そして、“鮎の川”の答えが、続く３行を経て“黄金郷の鍵”に辿り着く…。」
"Then, the answer behind the `sweetfish river' passes through the next three lines and makes its way to the `key to the Golden Land'..."

「こうして考えると３つの区分、というのは間違いかしら。正確には４つの区分ね。……“鮎の川を下り”、“黄金郷の鍵を見つけ”、“黄金郷へ旅立つ”、“そして黄金郷の宝”。」
"If you think about it this way, I wonder if it was a mistake to split it into three parts. There's actually four parts. ...`Go down the sweetfish river', `find the key to the Golden Land', `journey to the Golden Land', and `the treasure of the Golden Land'."

「ふぅむ…。……実に面白い。せっかくだ。続けて、碑文のもっとも中心的な部分である、黄金郷に辿り着く第十の晩までの見解を聞かせてくれんかね？」
"Hmmm... ...Truly intriguing. Well, you've gone this far. Would you mind continuing and telling us your opinion on the most central portion of the epitaph, up to the point when we reach the Golden Land on the tenth twilight?"

「……この碑文の中でもっとも象徴的で、…そして物騒な部分ね。」
"...That's the most symbolic...and also the most disturbing part."

「生贄なんて単語が連発するから、ついついお父様のオカルト儀式と関係があるんじゃないかと思ってしまうけど…。………霧江さんならどう見るかしら？」
"Since the word `sacrifices' keeps coming up, I can't help but think it has something to do with Father's occult ceremonies... ......How do you see it, Kyrie-san?"

霧江は、何度か腕の組み方を変えると、碑文を書き写した紙のさらに奥を透かし見るような遠い目をする…。
Kyrie recrossed her arms several times, peering into the paper with the epitaph copied onto it as though she was looking through it...

「………………………。………これは、とても難しいわね。…“鍵を手にせし者は”から始まるということは多分、鍵を理解していないと話が進まない。…お手上げではあるけれど、一応、挑戦してみるわね。」
"...............This is...very difficult. ...It starts with `the one who obtains the key', so you probably won't be able to continue without knowing what that key means. ...I'll have to give up on that, but I'll take a shot at trying to solve it anyway."

「……“鮎の川”が水の流れる川とは限らないように、その“鍵”もまた、本当に鍵の形状をしたものなのか、疑わしいわね。」
"...Just like how the `sweetfish river' isn't necessarily a river with water flowing down it, it's also doubtful that this `key' is actually something shaped like a key."

「そうね。暗号とかキーワードの可能性もあるわ。……だってこの鍵は、鍵穴に差すものじゃない。第一の晩に６人の生贄を選ぶためにあるんだもの。その意味においては、この鍵は黄金郷の扉を開くものじゃないと言い切れるわね。」
"Right. It might also be a code or a keyword. ...After all, this key isn't something to be stuck into a keyhole. It's something that selects six people to be sacrifices for the first twilight. In that sense, we can say for sure that this key isn't being used to open the door to the Golden Land."

「……しかし物騒な鍵です。
"...But what a disturbing key it is.

６人もの生贄を選ぶ鍵なんて…。」
A key that can choose six human sacrifices..."

"How would a key select anything? ...Do ya spin it like a roulette...?"

"This key indicates a certain group of six people. ...No, we should say it indicates a certain group of six things, ...if this doesn't mean a literal command to offer sacrifices. For example, it could be an anagram."

"An anagram? Do you mean playing with letters...?"

「えぇ。さっき楼座さんが家系図の話で、真里亞ちゃんの名前に里が含まれて、という話をしていた時からずっと考えてるの。

……例えば留弗夫さんは、懐かしき故郷という単語からずっと、地形的・座標的なものを想定しているようだけど、そうじゃないかもしれない。これはある種のなぞなぞ、…あるいは文字遊びかもしれないって。」
"...It seems that ever since the words `beloved hometown' came up, Rudolf-san, for example, has assumed that this epitaph points to some coordinates or some other geographical feature, but that might not be the case. This could be some kind of puzzle, ...or maybe playing with letters."

「……ごめんなさい。文字遊びとは何ですか？」
"...Forgive me, but how does one play with letters?"

「あぁ、カモメカモメカチンカチン、みたいなヤツさ。“カ”を抜いたらなぁに？
みたいな。夏妃さんは育ちがいいから知らねぇだろ。」
"Oh, well, it's like `sucker merry barrels'. Whaaat do you get when you take out the e's and r's?

Like that. Well, you were raised well, Natsuhi-san, so you probably don't know."

"...Merry?? Take out the e's and r's, huh? ???"

"Stop it. It is an undignified game, inappropriate for you."

夏妃だけがついていけず、きょとんとしている。
Only Natsuhi didn't get it and had a blank look on her face.

ただ、留弗夫や絵羽の失笑の雰囲気から、とりあえず答えが品のないものに違いないということだけは察したようだった。
It seemed she'd only guessed that the answer had to be something undignified, going by Rudolf and Eva's sniggers.

タの文字がいっぱい混じった暗号みたいな手紙があるんだけど、“タ”の文字を“抜く”と、そこに正しい文章が浮かび上がる、みたいな、そんな遊びがあるんですよ。」
"It's a notebook written like a code, with a lot of `ta's mixed in, and if you `remove' all of the `ta's, then the true paragraph pops up. It's a game like that."

夏妃は今頃になって、留弗夫の出した品のないなぞなぞの答えを知り、赤くなりながら俯く。
Natsuhi finally realized the answer to the undignified riddle Rudolf had posed, and her face grew red as she hung her head in embarrassment.

「……………その“抜く”、というのが、案外、“殺す”というのに転じるかもね…？」
"......So maybe `kill' actually means `remove' in that sense, right...?"

"Yes. I also thought that. It's possible that the key to the Golden Land is a word with six characters."

“鮎の川”、“それを下れ”、“そして鍵を見つけろ”と、非常に順番的。そしてその結果、６文字の鍵を手に入れたと仮定するんだけど、……そうすると、“何から”６文字を殺すのか、わからなくなるの。」
"`Sweetfish river', `go down it', `then find the key'...all of that is extremely sequential. And as a result, we can guess that we gain a six-character key, ...but in that case, we now don't know `what' we kill the six characters from."

"That's right. Where do we pull the six characters from? It doesn't tell us."

"...On the second twilight, there are `those who remain'. ...Which means that, at the very least, that `something' has a limited number of characters. You could read it like it's telling you to continue with the remaining characters after the first six characters are removed."

".........Hmmmmm..."

そこでみんな腕組みをして黙り込んでしまう。

これまでに至れなかった斬新な見解に辿り着けそうなのだが…、あと一歩のところで躓いてしまう。
It felt like they were about to reach a novel understanding they hadn't managed before, ...but they stumbled just one step short.

その時、秀吉が豪快にお腹を鳴らした。
Then, Hideyoshi's stomach rumbled heartily.

それまでの沈黙が笑いによって打ち破られる。

"Sorry, sorry. Strangely enough, by spinnin' the gears in my head for a change, my stomach's gone completely empty. Looks like I can't stand missin' breakfast, ...wahahahahaha."

"That will do for now. Would you mind getting those ready?"

男たちはすっかり思考を食い意地に奪われてしまったようだった。
場の空気は和み、碑文検討会はそれで一度解散となった。
It looked like the men had been taken over with an appetite that stopped all thought.

The atmosphere grew more peaceful, and the epitaph investigation team split up for the time being.

だが、絵羽は穴が空くほどに碑文が書かれた紙を睨み続けている…。

絵羽は素っ気無くそう言い放つ。
Eva spoke coldly.

...Kyrie didn't bother her any more, and instead went to help Natsuhi prepare breakfast.

"The Ushiromiya Family Headship will be given to the person who solves this epitaph. It looks like you've given up from the beginning, as if it has nothing to do with you, but if you can solve it, there's a chance even you'll be able to receive the Headship."

"...This is a chance to steal everything from Nii-san. Why aren't you taking such a once-in-a-lifetime chance more seriously?"

楼座は何と答えればいいかわからず、困って俯いた。

Rosa hung her head, unsure as to how she should answer.

...Too late, she regretted carelessly speaking to her sister when she was in a bad mood.

「あんたも、何か気付いたことがあるんなら言いなさいよ。私や霧江さんは真剣に推理してたのに、あんたは相槌ばかりだったじゃない。ほら。何か気付いた点はないの？　ほら！」
"If you've noticed anything, say so. Even though Kyrie-san and I were thinking hard, you just kept nodding your head, didn't you? Come on. Isn't there anything you've noticed? Come on!"

"Why does it say we'll receive the treasures `once and for the last time'? If we only get them once, then there's no point telling us it's the last time. When Virgilia and Ronove giggled and cackled,

Beatrice's irritation meter finally reached its limit.

ロノウェ、しばし姿を消せ！　消えろ消えろー！」
Ronove, vanish for a while! Disappear, disappeeear!"

"Certainly. Then I shall rest for the time being.

あとにはカリカリとイラついているベアトリーチェと、涼しげに紅茶を嗜むワルギリアの姿が残った。

戦人は魔女を否定するという本来の勝利目的に加え、１８人の誰も疑わずに解決したいという異なる勝利目的も持っていた。
In addition to denying the witch, Battler had possessed a second victory condition, one of explaining everything without suspecting one of the 18.

その相対する２つの目的に翻弄されている時こそが、彼のもっとも弱い瞬間だったはず。
It was at that point, when he'd been tossed about by two opposing goals, that his heart should have been at its weakest.

Battler was stubborn, but that was exactly why fissures would run all through him, like breaking china, when he was struck in a fragile spot.
