"...I figured that if I died, then I'd be dead and that would be that, more or less.

まぁその、ちょっとした運試しです。若気の至りってことで。」
Well, still, I was testing my luck a bit. Call it youthful zeal."

縁寿は、その話はもういいとでも言うように、素っ気無く肩をすくめる。
As though saying that she'd had enough of that topic, Ange shrugged coldly.

その様子に、ブラインドの隙間から眼下の下界を見下ろす老紳士はからからと笑った。
Seeing that, the old gentleman, who was looking at the world below through a crack in the blinds, cackled.

「運試しと来たか…！
"So, you were testing your luck, is that it...?

いやはや、やっぱり金蔵さんのお孫さんだねぇ。運否天賦に命を預けてもけろりとしてる、その度胸。…会長も博打に平気で命を賭けられる人だったが、これも右代宮の血なのかねぇ。……やっぱりあんた、将来大物になるよ。悪いことは言わない。家出ごっこはこの辺で切り上げて、須磨寺の家に戻ったらどうだい。」
My, my, you truly are Kinzo-san's grandchild. The nerve to trust your life to chance. ...The Chairman was also a woman who could stake her life on a bet like it was nothing, so maybe this really is the Ushiromiya blood at work. ...You really will make it big in the future. Please, let me be blunt. Why not give up this running away from home act and return to the Sumadera family?"

「お母さん、実家と仲が悪かったって聞いてます。お葬式で初対面の人の家になんて、行きたくないです。」
"I heard that Mom had a bad relationship with her family. I don't want to go to the house of people I first met at a funeral."

須磨寺家は母の実家だ。
The Sumaderas are Mom's family.

京都のちょっとした旧家で、お母さんのフランクな様子からは想像もつかないくらいに厳格な一族だ。
They're an old family from Kyoto, and compared to Mom's frank attitude, unbelievably strict.

私が唯一、須磨寺家で仲が良かったのは、隠居という名の別居をしているお祖父ちゃんだけだった。
The only Sumadera I'd been on good terms with was Grandpa, who was living apart from his family under the guise of retirement.

母も、お祖父ちゃんとだけは交流を持っていたが、他の親族には険悪なまでに一切、関わり合わなかった。
私も、須磨寺家で遊びに行ったのはお祖父ちゃんの家だけだ。
Mom kept in touch with him too, but she avoided the rest of the family completely, almost hostilely so.

So when I went out to play with the Sumadera family, it was always Grandpa's house I visited.

幼い私は、当時はよくわからなかったが、お祖父ちゃんは入り婿で立場も非常に弱く、お祖母ちゃんとの仲も悪かったという。
When I was young, I didn't really understand it, but I hear that Grandpa was in an extremely weak position, as a man who'd moved into his wife's family register, and his relationship with Grandma was also bad.

…むしろ、お祖母ちゃんに嫌われ、蟄居させられていたとすら、言い切れたかもしれない。
...You might even say that Grandma hated him and confined him to the house.

そんなお祖父ちゃんにだけ心を許していたということは、恐らく、母も、須磨寺家には嫌われていただろうことは、想像に難くない。
It isn't hard to imagine that, because she had a soft spot for Grandpa alone, Mom was also hated by the Sumaderas.

その娘である私も、さぞや嫌われていたことだろう。
Since I was her daughter, they probably hated me quite a bit too.

にもかかわらず、お母さんたちのお葬式の時に初めて現れて、大きくなったわね、何てしゃあしゃあとのたまって、よくも今さら親族面が出来るものだ…。
And yet, they appeared for the first time at Mom's funeral, shamelessly going on about how big I'd gotten, like they could actually act like family after all this time...

絵羽伯母さんが死んだ後、右代宮家の全ての財産は私が相続している。
それが目当てでなかったら、あんな虫唾が走るような言葉を口になんか出来るものか。
When Aunt Eva died, I would inherit all the wealth of the Ushiromiya family.

If that wasn't what they were after, there's no way they would've been able to say such disgusting words.

「……まぁ、ひとりぼっちになっちまって、自暴自棄になりたい縁寿ちゃんの気持ちも、わからなくもないなぁ。」
"...Well, it's not as though I can't understand your desire for self-abandonment, now that you're all alone."

「自暴自棄とかじゃないです。小うるさい絵羽伯母さんもやっとくたばったんで、久し振りに伸び伸びと散歩してるだけじゃないですか。……周りが大袈裟に騒ぎ過ぎなだけです。」
"This isn't self-abandonment. I'm just taking a carefree stroll now that that annoying Aunt Eva has finally kicked the bucket. ...Everyone else is just making too big a deal out of it."

どうせみんなの目当ては、私が背負ってる莫大な右代宮家の財産なのだ。
Of course, everyone's after the vast Ushiromiya wealth I bear.

私の後見人になれば、財産を自由に出来ると思ってるに違いない。
私の親代わりになろうと言って近付いてくる連中がどれだけ大勢いることか。
They must think that becoming my guardian means they'll be able to do as they please with that wealth.

Just how many people have tried to get close to me, acting like they want to be a substitute parent?

「縁寿ちゃんも、辛いことがあったら、俺で良かったらいつでも相談してな？　縁寿ちゃんのこと、実の孫みたいに思ってるんだからさ。」
"If you ever find that you're hurting, please talk with me if it will help, okay? After all, I think of you as my own grandchild, Ange-chan."

「………………………はぁ。…当面はノーサンキューということで。
"............Haah. ...I'll say for now.

…それより、話を戻して下さい。」
...More importantly, let's return to what we were talking about."

「縁寿ちゃん。何度聞かれたって、俺が隠してることは何もないよ。あの日の六軒島の唯一の生き残りが会長なんだ。その会長が、何も語らずに逝っちまった。
"Ange-chan, no matter how many times you ask, I am hiding nothing. The Chairman was the only survivor on Rokkenjima that day. And she passed away without saying anything.

俺だって何もわからないよ。全ては闇の中、だ。」
I myself know nothing. Everything is wrapped in darkness, you see."

老紳士は、絵羽亡き後、彼女が築き上げた企業グループを任された重鎮の一人だった。
This old gentleman was one of those leaders who had been entrusted with the business group Eva had built up after she passed away.

彼が会長と呼ぶのは、前会長、右代宮絵羽のことだ。
The one he called Chairman was the former Chairman, Ushiromiya Eva.

彼の会社はかつて、秀吉の会社と友好的な関係にあり、秀吉や絵羽とも親密な交流があった。
His company once had friendly ties with Hideyoshi's business, and he'd had a close relationship with both Hideyoshi and Eva.

その為、秀吉を失った後の絵羽が、唯一本音を漏らせる人物だったともされる。
For that reason, when Eva lost Hideyoshi, he became the only person to whom Eva might have let her true intentions slip.

家族を失った絵羽が心を病み、縁寿に辛く当たるようになると、彼はその間の緩衝材的な役割も担ってくれたため、心が許せるほどではないが、縁寿にとっても訪ねやすい人物だった…。
Whenever Eva's heart was torn by the loss of her family, whenever she took it out on Ange, he had acted as a buffer between the two, so although Ange didn't trust him, she found him a very easy person to question...

「あの事件は、
…いや、事故か。事件なんて言っちまったら怒られちまうなぁ。…そりゃ俺も世間やワイドショーと同じ程度の疑問は持ったさ。」
"That crime was...

no, that accident. If I call it a crime, I'll get in trouble. ...I had the same questions about it as the public and the talk shows."

「……どうして絵羽伯母さんは事故当時、屋敷から２ｋｍも離れたところに、たったひとりで？　それも嵐の晩に。」
"...At the time of the accident, why was Aunt Eva in a place 2 kilometers away from the mansion, all alone? And on the night of a storm."

「当時、金蔵さんは次の跡継ぎに誰を選ぶかで迷われていた。……表向きは長男の蔵臼さんってことになってたんだが、蔵臼さんはあまり信頼されていなかったんだ。」
"Back then, Kinzo-san was unsure as to whom he should select to be his successor. ...Officially, he'd decided on his son, Krauss-san, but he didn't have much trust in that man."

「……それで、親兄弟４人の中から公平に跡継ぎを決めるため、碑文の謎というゲーム染みた試練を課した…？」
"...So, to fairly determine a successor from among the four siblings, he made this game-like test called the riddle of the epitaph...?"

「それは表向きだなぁ。……恐らく金蔵さんは、初めから絵羽さんを当主跡継ぎにするつもりだったんだ。長男が跡継ぎだという自らのルールを撤回してでも、蔵臼さんと違い、非常に勤勉で優秀だった絵羽さんに家を任せたかったんだ。
"Ostensibly, yes. ...Kinzo-san probably planned to make Eva-san the Successor from the beginning. He wanted to withdraw his own rule that the eldest son be the Successor, and instead of Krauss-san, leave the family to the extremely diligent and brilliant Eva-san."

…碑文の謎を解いた者に家督を引き継ぐなどという新ルールは、蔵臼さんから次期当主の肩書きを奪うためだけの茶番だったんだろうな。」
"...The new rule about giving the inheritance to the one who solved the epitaph...was probably nothing more than a farce to snatch the position of Successor away from Krauss-san."

「茶番って、どういう意味ですか？」
"What do you mean...by farce?"

「あの碑文は誰にも解ける必要はなかったのさ。適当に掲示期間を経た後、本当に金蔵さんが跡を継がせたかった絵羽さんを呼び出し、
"There was no need for anyone to solve that epitaph. Once it had been displayed for an appropriate amount of time, Kinzo-san could just call Eva-san, whom he truly wanted to succeed him,

~ib~その答えを与える~ib~だけでいい。つまり、それこそが当主継承の証ってわけさ。」
~ib~and give her the answer~ib~. In other words, that itself would provide proof of her succession to the Headship."

「………………それはワイドショーでは言われていない話ですね？」
".........This isn't something they've brought up on the talk shows, is it?"

「まぁ、当主継承が云々なんて話をしたら、余計、陰謀説が優勢になっちゃうからねぇ。俺も馬鹿じゃないからさ。誤解を招くようなことはわざわざ口にしないよ？」
"Well, once you bring up the succession of the Headship, conspiracy theories tend to rise to the surface. I'm no fool myself. I won't go out of my way to say things that could invite misunderstandings, you see?"

彼の話はこうだった。
This was his theory.

当時の右代宮家では、余命わずかと宣告された当主の金蔵が、跡継ぎ問題に頭を悩ませていた。
At that time, the Ushiromiya Family Head, Kinzo, whose remaining life was announced to be short, was troubled by the problem of who was to succeed him.

本来なら跡継ぎは、自らが定めた長男の蔵臼に決まる。
Normally, the Successor would be fixed as the oldest son, Krauss, whom Kinzo had chosen himself.

…しかし、晩年の金蔵は、絵羽の方が当主に相応しいと思い始めていたというのだ。
...But in his later years, Kinzo began to think that Eva would make a more fitting Family Head.

しかし自らにも頑固な金蔵は、自ら蔵臼に与えた次期当主という肩書きが邪魔で、蔵臼を飛び越えて絵羽を次期当主に選ぶことの出来る~ib~建前~ib~を探していた。
However, Kinzo, who was stubborn even against himself, was stymied by the title of Successor that he'd already given to Krauss, and he'd searched for an ~ib~official stance~ib~ by which he could skip over Krauss and select Eva as his successor.

その建前が、碑文の謎。
That official stance was the riddle of the epitaph.

本来の当主跡継ぎは蔵臼だが、もしもその謎を解く者が現れたなら、そちらを当主跡継ぎに選ぶという新たなルール。
The primary successor was still Krauss, but there was a new rule, saying that if someone appeared who could solve the riddle, they would be chosen as the Successor to the Headship.

そして金蔵は、恐らく自分にとって最後になるであろう親族会議の日に、その謎を自ら絵羽に伝えた。
Then, on what would probably be his final family conference, Kinzo told Eva the answer to that riddle himself.

……それはつまり、絵羽こそが次期当主であるという宣言にも等しいわけだ。
...In short, it was the same as proclaiming that Eva herself was the Successor.

「絵羽さんは、あの日、金蔵さんに呼ばれ、それを打ち明けられたんだ。そして、当主を引き継ぐため、当主だけが知る隠し館である九羽鳥庵に絵羽さんを呼びつけたのだ。」
"On that day, Eva-san was summoned by Kinzo-san, who revealed the answer to her. And, so that she could succeed the Headship, he called Eva-san to the hidden mansion Kuwadorian, which only the Head knew about."

「………で、一足早くその隠し館で待っていた絵羽伯母さんは、そのお陰で事故の難を逃れた、と？　絵羽伯母さんが、全ての財産を奪うために、事故を装ってみんなを殺し、自分だけ難を逃れただけかもしれない。」
"......And because Aunt Eva arrived at the hidden mansion one step ahead, she escaped harm in that accident, you say? Maybe Aunt Eva just killed everyone and made it look like an accident, so she could steal all of the wealth for herself, and maybe that's why only she escaped unharmed."

「大衆紙はそう騒いでるなぁ。
"Well, that's what the papers are shouting about.

だが、俺は絵羽さんを信じてるよ。……信ずるに足るポイントが、いくつかあると思ってる。」
However, I believe Eva-san. ...I'd say there are several points that justify trusting her."

「例えば…？」
"For example...?"

「今、縁寿ちゃんが指に通してるその、右代宮家当主の指輪だよ。その指輪は金蔵さんが特別に作らせた世界に１つしかない指輪だ。そして、今、縁寿ちゃんが指にしているものは、間違いなくそれだと、作った細工師も認めてる。」
"That ring of the Ushiromiya Family Head, which is on your finger now, Ange-chan. That ring is the only one of its kind in the world, which Kinzo-san had made specially. And the artisan who made it acknowledges that the object on your finger is, without a doubt, that ring."

右代宮家、当主の指輪。
The Ushiromiya Family...Head's Ring.

黄金の重みがあり、片翼の紋章の入ったその指輪には、台座の部分にダイヤがあしらわれ、重厚感と金持ち的な悪趣味さを兼ね備えている。
That ring, with the heft of gold and the one-winged seal on it, had a diamond arranged on a pedestal, and felt both sturdy and reminiscent of the dark hobbies of the rich.

それは、金蔵が一時も外すことなく指にはめていたものだ。
Kinzo had worn that on his finger without removing it even for a moment.

それを絵羽が持つということは、金蔵が当主跡継ぎと認めた証に他ならない、というのだ。
This man was saying that the fact Eva had it proved that Kinzo had acknowledged her as the Successor.

「その指輪を確かに絵羽さんが持つからこそ。そして、実際に絵羽さんが優秀で、蔵臼さんにはビジネスシーンでの数々の醜態が知られていたことを加味すると、絵羽さんの話はまったくの作り話とは思えないんだ。」
"After all, Eva-san certainly did have that ring. And, if you take into consideration that Eva-san actually was talented, and that Krauss-san had made a fool of himself several times on the business scene, I cannot imagine that Eva-san's story is completely made up."

「…………その指輪を奪うために、お祖父さまを殺害した可能性だってあるけれど。そして絵羽伯母さんは、何らかの細工をして、事故に見せ掛けて一族を皆殺しにした。」
"......Although there's the possibility that she murdered Grandfather in order to steal that ring. Then Aunt Eva, using some kind of trick, massacred everyone and made it look like an accident."

「そうだなぁ。大衆紙は財産の独り占めが目当てで一族を皆殺しにした、なんて言ってるようだなぁ。
"Ah, yes. It seems the papers were saying something about her massacring everyone, with keeping all the wealth to herself as a goal.

確かに、絵羽さんはここ一番ではずいぶん思い切ったこともしちゃう人だよ。あるいは、……右代宮家の財産を独り占めできるチャンスに、生涯でただ一度の殺人を犯したかもしれない。…………だがね、俺はそうは思わない。」
True, Eva-san was a person capable of holding back nothing when she was determined to accomplish something. Or, ...she may have committed murder just once in her life...if a chance for keeping all the Ushiromiya family wealth for herself presented itself. ......However, I don't think that happened."

「そう信ずるに足るポイントの２つ目は？」
"So, what's the second point that justifies your trust in her?"

「絵羽さんのご家族だよ。秀吉さんに譲治くん。……縁寿ちゃんはにわかには信じ難いだろうけど、絵羽さんはあれでかなり家族を大事にする人だったんだ。」
"Eva-san's family. Hideyoshi-san and George-kun. ...It might be difficult for you to believe all of a sudden, Ange-chan, but Eva-san was a person who treasured family greatly."

……確かににわかには信じたくないし、認めたくはない。
でも、薄々はわかっている。
...True, part of me didn't want to believe it or acknowledge it.

But I did understand vaguely.

確かに絵羽伯母さんは、家族をとても大切にしている人だった。
彼女の歪んだ人格の根底にあるのは、最愛の夫と息子を失った悲しみがあるだけなのだ。
Aunt Eva certainly had been a person who highly treasured her family.

After all, the root of her twisted personality had been nothing more than the sadness of losing her beloved husband and son.

それを紛らわせるために八つ当たりされてきた私には、まったく同情する気持ちはないが、……それでも、彼女の人格を変容させるほどのショックを、家族全滅が与えたことは想像できなくもない。
After getting hit with her angry outbursts as she tried to distract herself from that pain, I have no feelings of sympathy at all, ...but it's not like I can't imagine how the incredible shock of losing her whole family must've changed her character.

「……家族を愛した絵羽伯母さんが、夫と息子を見捨てるわけがないと？」
"...You're saying there's no way Aunt Eva, who loved her family, would throw away her husband and her son?"

「そうだ。もし本当に絵羽さんが犯人で、一族を事故に見せ掛けて皆殺しにしたならば。……夫と息子が、絶対に生き残ってるはずなんだ。
"That's right. Even if Eva-san really was the culprit and massacred the entire family, making it look like an accident, ...she most certainly would have spared her husband and her son."

偶然、自分の家族だけが隠し館にいたと、屁理屈をこねてね。もし、秀吉さんと譲治くんも無事だったなら、さすがの俺でも、絵羽さんの陰謀を疑ったろうよ。
"She would quibble that, by coincidence, only her family had been in the hidden mansion. If Hideyoshi-san and George-kun had been safe, even I would probably suspect Eva-san."

……俺は、秀吉さんの葬儀で見せた、絵羽さんのあの号泣を演技だなんて到底思えんねぇ。」
"...I truly cannot imagine that Eva-san's wailing at Hideyoshi-san's funeral was an act."

「………どっちも状況証拠的ですね。絵羽伯母さんの潔白を、物理的に示すには至らない。」
"......Sounds like both points so far are just circumstantial evidence. That isn't the same as physically proving Aunt Eva's innocence."

「はっはっはっは。それを言っちゃおしまいだよ。生き残ったのは絵羽さんのみ。その彼女がそれが真実だ、と言うんだからさ。」
"Hahahaha. If you say that, then you're stuck right away. Eva-san was the only survivor. And she says that this is the truth."

「でも、彼女の潔白は誰にも証明できない。」
"But no one can prove her innocence."

「あぁ、そうさ。そして彼女の犯行も、誰にも証明できない。」
"Yes, that's right. And no one can prove that she committed a crime either."

「…………………………。」
"............"

「そして信ずるべきポイントの最後が、警察だ。
"And the final point that justifies trusting her...is the police.

何しろ、派手な事件だったからね。陰謀説を騒ぐ世論に後押しされて、警察がずいぶんと絵羽さんを調べたはずさ。」
After all, it was such a flashy crime. The police were being pushed forward by a public in an uproar over conspiracy theories, so they must have investigated Eva-san thoroughly."

絵羽だけが隠し館に逃れていたために、偶然、事故を逃れた、とする点に不自然さを感じることも出来るだろう。
It was easy to feel something unnatural about the claim that Eva had avoided the accident by coincidence...because she alone had escaped to a hidden mansion.

また、当時、秀吉の会社は乗っ取り騒ぎの真っ最中にあり、大株主の買収のために、多額の現金を欲しがっていた。
Furthermore, at the time, Hideyoshi's company had been right in the middle of a takeover struggle, and in order to buy off the big stockholders, she'd wanted a large sum of cash.

その点に動機を見出すことも、難しくはないはずだ。
It shouldn't be too hard to find a motive there.

しかし、親族会議に向かう絵羽の身辺は、まったくにもって普通だった。
一族を事故に見せ掛けて虐殺するような、あらゆる不自然な準備が見つけられなかったのだ。
But as a matter of fact, there had been nothing at all that implicated Eva as she went to the family conference.

Nothing unnatural was found on her that could've been used to brutally murder her family and make it look like an accident.

当日は非番で難を逃れた使用人たちも、彼女を含め、全ての関係者について不自然な様子が見られなかったと証言した。
The servants who escaped harm by being off-duty on that day also stated that they hadn't seen anything strange regarding anyone related to the event, Eva included.

それらを総合的に判断する限り、右代宮絵羽は普段の親族会議と何ら変わることなく、六軒島に向かい、事故に遭遇したと結論するしかないのだ…。
Putting all of that together, it could only be concluded that Ushiromiya Eva had headed to Rokkenjima for a normal family conference, without any change, and had encountered an accident...

「警察が、あれだけ散々調べて、事件性を見出すことが出来なかった。
"The police looked so intensely, and they still couldn't find evidence that it was a crime.

……警察がそう断じた。それで六軒島疑惑は決着じゃないのかなぁ。」
...They reached that conclusion themselves. Doesn't this resolve the Rokkenjima Suspicion?"

「……それは単に、警察は事件性を~ib~発見できなかった~ib~、ってだけの話じゃないんですか？」
"...That just means that the police ~ib~couldn't find~ib~ evidence that it was a crime, right?"

「それを言い出したらキリがないなぁ。悪魔の証明になっちまうよ。犯罪を暴くには証拠を見つければいい。でも、無実を示すには何を見つけりゃいいんだい？　消極的事実の証明は不可能だ。」
"There's nothing I can say to counter that. It becomes a Devil's Proof. To expose it as her crime, you would simply need to find evidence. But what could you possibly find to prove her innocence? It's impossible to prove a negative fact."

「……絵羽伯母さんが、犯罪を犯したか、否か。それを判断する材料が見付からないから、そのまま真相は迷宮入り、ということですね。」
"...Did Aunt Eva commit a crime, or did she not...? Because we can't find any materials that'll let us say for sure, the truth will remain a mystery... That's what you're saying, right?"

「………そうだな。縁寿ちゃんの期待する言い方にするとそうなるな。絵羽さん自身にだって、自分の無実は証明不能なのさ。
"......That's it. Phrased in a manner you would prefer, that's what it amounts to. It was impossible even for Eva-san to prove her own innocence.

あの島で不幸な事故があった。そしてたまたま絵羽さんが生き残った。しかもそれ以上のことは何もわからない！
On that island, an unfortunate accident occurred. And Eva-san survived by chance. And we don't know any more than that!"

つまるところ、唯一の生存者である、絵羽さんの話を、信じられるか否か、ってことになるわけさ。
"In short, it all comes down to whether you believe the story of the only survivor, Eva-san, or not.

……俺は信じたよ。指輪の話や、彼女の尊敬できる家族愛。そして葬儀で見せた涙。それらを加味して考えて、彼女の話を信じようと思ったんだ。」
...I believed. The ring and her praiseworthy love for her family. And the tears she shed at the funeral. Taking all of that into consideration, I decided to believe her story."

「……でも、私は信じない。指輪なんて奪う気なら方法はいくらでもあるだろうし、家族仲が本当に良かったかなんて誰にもわからない。葬儀の涙が本物かなんて証明不能。
"...But I don't believe. If she wanted to steal the ring, there were probably many ways for her to do it, and no one knows if her relationship with her family really was that good. No one can prove that tears at a funeral are real."

……というか、私はそもそも絵羽伯母さんなんて大嫌い。だから私は彼女の話を信じようなんて思わない。」
"...Anyway, I hated Aunt Eva from the very beginning. So I don't even want to believe her."

「はっはっはっは…。事件の真相をどう見るか。俺と縁寿ちゃんで真っ向から対立しちまったなぁ。俺たちに与えられてる情報はまったく同じなのに、まったく異なる見解を持っちまう。
"Hahahaha... How does one view the truth of the crime? You and I are on completely opposing sides. Even though the information we are given is exactly the same, we interpret it in completely different ways."

………こういうこと、政治や経済でもよくあるんだ。同じ事業をやっても、必ず評価は分かれちまう。どうしてかわかるかい？」
"......This happens often in politics and business. The exact same enterprise will always be assessed in multiple, differing ways. Do you know why?"

「………いいえ？」
"......Why?"

「愛があるかどうか、さ。……相手に愛を感じてるかどうかで、ものの見え方はまったく違うってことなんだ。好きな人が貧しい人に施しをすれば、尊敬できるだろ？　でも嫌いなヤツが施しなんて始めたら、売名行為だとかバラ撒き行政だとか、非難轟々さ。
"It's a question of whether one has love. ...Whether you feel love for someone or not completely changes how you view them. If a person you like gives to the poor, you respect them for it, right? But if someone you hate starts donating, you fiercely protest that it's a publicity stunt or that they're handing out favors."

何をしてもしなくても、愛があれば感謝し、愛がなければ非難する。それが世の中ってもんなんだ。」
"No matter what they do or don't do, you thank them if you have love and criticize them if you don't. That's how the world works."

「絵羽伯母さんのことを、信じられるか信じられないか、……それだけの違いってことですか？」
"Can Aunt Eva be trusted, or can't she...? ...You're saying that's all that really matters?"

「彼女を疑う人間には、彼女が何をしてもしなくても、それは実に不自然に見えるだろうさ。逆も然り。……俺はね。世の中には真実なんてものは、よっぽどのことがない限り、存在しないんじゃないかと思うね。
"Those who suspect her will probably take anything she does or doesn't do and truly see it as something unnatural. And it works in reverse. ...As for me, I think that, barring certain extreme cases, truth might not exist in this world at all."

いや、仮にもし。真実が存在したとしても、それを信じるか信じないかは、愛があるか否かで決められちまう。……絶対性の宿らない真実なんて、真実と呼べるのかい？　絵羽さんが物理的なアリバイを示したとしても、君はそれを信じられたかい？」
"No, even if truth does exist, whether you believe it or not is determined by whether you have love or not. ...Can you really call truth without certainty truth? Even if Eva-san had been able to show physical proof that she had an alibi, would you have been able to believe it?"

「………………………。」
"........."

それを言われると弱い。
It's hard to counter that.

…私は絵羽伯母さんが大嫌いだから、彼女に利するあらゆる情報は否定するし、中立的なあらゆる情報は悪意を以って解釈するだろう。
...I hate Aunt Eva, so I'll probably deny any information beneficial to her...and interpret any neutral information in a negative way.

……つまり、私の中で、もう真実は決め付けられているのだ。
にもかかわらず、なおも満たされずに探す“真実”とは一体、何物なのか…。
...In other words, the truth is already decided inside me.

So just what in the world is this `truth' that I'm still searching for, unsatisfied...?

「そういうことさ。つまり、俺から何を聞こうとも、縁寿ちゃんが絵羽さんを未だ疑っている以上、何を聞いても今さら何も変わらないってことなのさ。少なくとも、今の縁寿ちゃんじゃ、仮に未知の新事実を掴んだとしても、真相に至ることは出来んと思うねぇ。」
"That's how it is. So, no matter what you hear from me, since you still suspect Eva-san after all this time, nothing will change. At the very least, even if you were to grasp a piece of hitherto unknown information, I don't think you'd be able to reach the truth the way you are now."

「………私では真相に、
…至れませんか。」
"......So I can't...

reach the truth?"

「だって。縁寿ちゃんは、どんな新情報や新証拠が見付かったって、絵羽さんが犯人だってスタンスは変えないんだろ？
"After all, no matter what kind of new information or proof you find, Ange-chan, it won't change your stance that Eva-san is the culprit, right?

なら、これ以上、何を調べたって意味はないじゃないか。
So it's pointless to investigate anything more. Because

~ib~君の中の真相はすでに決まっている~ib~わけさ。」
~ib~the truth inside of you is already decided~ib~."

「………………………。」
"............"

「だが、もし。縁寿ちゃんがそれを真相と思わずに、さらに奥深くの本当の真相に辿り着きたいと願うなら、一個だけ方法があるよ。
"However... If you stop assuming that to be the truth, if you wish to struggle further towards the deeper, real truth, there is a single way.

もう話したつもりなんだけどな。何だかわかるかい。」
I believe I already mentioned it, but do you know what it is?"

「……愛、ですか？　よく意味がわからないです。」
"...Is it...love? I don't really know what you mean."

「縁寿ちゃんは今、絵羽さんを犯人だと仮定し、物を考えている。でも、それじゃ片目で物を見てるようなものなんだ。片目じゃ、どんなに目を凝らしても物を立体的に見ることは出来ないだろ？　だから、もうひとつ目がいるんだ。もちろん、今の目とは別の立場での。」
"Right now, you're considering this under the assumption that Eva-san is the culprit. But that's no different from looking at something with a single eye. With one eye, no matter how much you squint, you cannot see an object in three dimensions, right? That's why we have another eye. And of course, it's in a different position from the first eye."

「…………絵羽伯母さんが、犯人ではない、…あるいは、本当に事故であるという仮定にも基づいて、物事を見ろと…？」
"......You're telling me to look at things based on the supposition that Aunt Eva isn't the culprit, ...or else, that it was a real accident...?"

「そうそう、その通り。物事を考える時には、異なる立ち位置から見るようにするんだ。そうじゃないと、本当のことは何もわからない。
"Yes, yes, that's correct. When thinking about anything, you should always try to look at it from different perspectives. If you don't, you won't understand anything about what is real."

新聞だってそうさ。ひとつの新聞だけじゃ、その記事を書いた記者の目線ひとつでしかものが見られない。複数の新聞を読むことで初めて、立体的かつ冷静に分析が出来ることもある。
"It's the same with newspapers. You can't see anything from the single viewpoint of a writer who wrote an article in a single newspaper. Sometimes you can only process information composedly and in three dimensions when you read multiple newspapers."

……愛がなければ真実は視えない。………ん〜、いいねぇ、わっはっはっは。」
"...Without love, the truth cannot be seen. ......Hmm, sounds nice, wahahaha."

キザったらしい言葉が口を出たのが面白かったのだろう。しばらくの間、楽しそうに笑っていた。
Maybe he thought it interesting that such a flashy phrase would pop out of his mouth. For a while, he laughed, looking pleased.

……それは同時に、知っていることは全て話した、この辺で引き上げてくれないかという意思表示でもある。私はそれを理解し、腰を上げた。
...At the same time, he was telling me that he'd said everything he knew...and that it was about time to leave. I understood that and got to my feet.

「俺にも縁寿ちゃんの気持ちがわかったよ。あんたが納得するように、しばらく好きにしたらいい。
"I do understand your feelings, Ange-chan. You should do as you like for a while, until you're satisfied."

……当時、君は６歳だった。わけがわからない内に家族を失い、未だに心の整理がつかない気持ち、よくわかるんだ。」
"...You were six years old at the time. I understand how you must feel after losing your family before you could even understand what that meant...and how you must still be unable to sort out your heart."

「………………………。」
"............"

「真相はわかるかもしれない、わからないかもしれない。絵羽さんは犯人かもしれないし、犠牲者かもしれない。
"You may learn the truth, and you may not. Eva-san may be the culprit, and she may be a victim.

……縁寿ちゃんが信じる“真実”が見つけられるのを、祈ってるよ。若い内の旅も、貴重な経験かもしれない。」
...I pray that you find the `truth' you believe in, Ange-chan. A journey at such a young age may prove to be a valuable experience."

「ありがとうございます…。……お忙しいところ、お邪魔して本当に済みませんでした、小此木さん。」
"Thank you very much... ...I'm truly sorry to be such a bother when you're so busy, Okonogi-san."




「いいって、いいって。これからどうするんだ？」
"No trouble, no trouble. What are you going to do now?"

「まぁ、適当に。……事件関係者や、その道の専門家ってやつに何人かアポを入れてるので、そちらを当たるつもりです。」
"Well, whatever works. ...I've made appointments with several specialists and people related to the crime, and I plan to go visit them."

「そうか。納得のいく答えが見つかるといいな。」
"I see. I hope you find an answer you can accept."

その時、小此木社長の秘書が入ってきて、メモを一枚、肩越しに手渡した。
At that time, company president Okonogi's secretary came in, handing him a memo over his shoulder.

それを読み、私の顔と見比べる。
He read it, then looked between it and my face.

「……縁寿ちゃん。旅に出てごらんと言った矢先で申し訳ないんだが、耳に入れといた方がいい情報だ。……君、今だいぶヤバイらしいね？」
"...Ange-chan, my apologies that this comes right after telling you to try going on a journey, but I have some information you should lend an ear to. ...It looks like you're in a bit of a nasty fix right now."

「私のカネを狙ってる連中ですか？　だからお金なんて下らない。」
"People after my money? This is why money's stupid."

「だからって、財産丸ごと売っ払って、全額を福祉に寄付しようなんてしたら、縁寿ちゃんの財産で皮算用してる連中が、目ン玉、飛び出しちまうよ。」
"Yes, but if you sell off all of the wealth, trying to donate the whole sum to the public welfare, you'll make the eyes pop out of those people optimistic about their chances with your fortune."

「あぁ、須磨寺の家ですか。あいつら、何を偉そうに保護者面して。」
"Oh, the Sumadera family? Those guys act so proud, like they're my guards or something."

絵羽伯母さんの前例がある。
誰が須磨寺の家に世話になんかなるもんか。
I haven't forgotten Aunt Eva.

There's no way I'll put myself in the care of the Sumadera family.

それこそ、絵羽伯母さんがよく脅していたように、両手両足をブツ切りにされて、蔵か何かに放り込まれて、右代宮の財産をしゃぶり尽くすつもりだろう。
They probably want to, as Aunt Eva often threatened in the past, cut off my arms and legs, throw me in a warehouse, and suck the Ushiromiya family's wealth dry.

「須磨寺家の使いがここに来るそうだ。
"Apparently, a messenger from the Sumadera family is coming here.

君を引き渡せと、いやいや、保護したいと言ってるな。」
They're saying to hand you over...no, no, that they want to protect you."

「使いって？」
"A messenger, you say?"

「君の叔母だよ。霧江さんの妹さんだ。君の事を妹のように思っていると前に話してたな。」
"It's your aunt. Kyrie-san's younger sister. I believe she told me earlier that she thinks of you as a little sister."

「ご冗談。せめて孫と言ってよ、あのババア。」
"She's gotta be joking. At least call me a granddaughter, you old hag."

「文脈から見るに、君の意思は聞く気がないようだ。地下２階の駐車場に車が待たせてある。行きなさい。」
"Judging from the context, it seems they have no wish to listen to your desires. I have a car waiting in the parking lot two stories underground. Go."

「……須磨寺の家から引き渡せって言われてるんでしょ。いいの、私を行かせて？」
"...The Sumadera family is telling you to hand me over. Is it really okay to let me go?"

「縁寿ちゃんはきっと将来大物になるよ。この貸しは、その時の出世払いってことにしとこう。
"You will definitely become something big in the future, Ange-chan. Let us call this a favor to be repaid upon your success.

…行きな、早く…！」
...Go, quickly...!"

縁寿は無言で深く会釈をしてから、早歩きにその場を退出した。
After bowing silently and deeply, Ange left that place at a dash.

彼女が出て行ったのを見届けてから、秘書の女性が眼鏡を直しながら囁く。
After watching her leave, the female secretary straightened her glasses and whispered.

「須磨寺家からは足止めをしておくように言われていますが…。行かせてよろしいのですか？」
"The Sumadera family told us to stall her... Is it really all right to let her go?"

「足止めならしたよ、充分に。それに間に合わないのは須磨寺の過失だね。……縁寿ちゃんには逃げろと言ったし。須磨寺には縁寿ちゃんが来てるよと通報したし。捕まっても捕まらなくても双方に恨まれない。
"We did stall her, more than enough. If they still don't make it in time, that's their own fault. ...I told Ange-chan to run for it. I informed the Sumaderas that Ange-chan would be coming. Whether she's caught or not, I will not be blamed."

……世の中はすべからく、愛、だねぇ…。大丈夫、逃げ果せるよ。何しろ、追っ手撒くためにビルから飛び降りられる子だからねぇ。」
"...Everything in this world...is love, you see... Don't worry, she'll escape. After all, that child's capable of leaping off a building to shake pursuers."

……小此木はブラインドの隙間から再び下界を見下ろし、さすがに俺には無理だなぁと呟くのだった。
...Okonogi looked down again through a crack in the blinds, muttering `Nope, definitely couldn't do it...'

縁寿も馬鹿ではない。
Ange wasn't a fool herself.

エレベーターから降りる彼女だが、そこは地上の３階だった。
She got off the elevator, but on the third floor.

地下２階にタクシー？
A taxi in the second level of the basement?

ご丁寧すぎて気持ち悪い。ここは辞退した方がいいだろう。
That's so neat and clean that I don't like it. It's probably better to refuse for now.

だが、敵も馬鹿じゃない。
地下駐車場だけでなく、１階ロビーも抑えられているだろう。
But my enemies aren't fools either.

They're probably waiting in the first floor lobby, as well as the underground parking lot.

これだけの巨大なビルなのだ。
焦って外へ脱出せず、中でやり過ごした方がいいだろうか。
It's such a massive building.

Instead of getting anxious and escaping outside, maybe it's better to stay inside and wait it out.

いや、駄目だ。
この近代的なビルは彼らがセキュリティルームを掌握してしまえば、私の逃げ場などなくなる。
No, that's useless.

If they get their hands on a security room in a modern building like this, I'll have nowhere to run to.

このビル全体が、巨大な袋小路も同じなのだ。
This entire building is like a massive dead end.

３階は業務フロア。小娘の私は、明らかに目立つ存在だ。
The third floor is the business floor. A young girl like me will clearly stick out.

これ以上、不要に目立たぬよう、早足で歩きながら非常階段を探す。
……できればその階段が、外階段であれば理想的。
Trying not to stand out any more than I had to, I walked at a brisk pace, searching for an emergency exit.

...It'd be perfect if that staircase was an outside one.

非常階段の扉を見つける。
I found the door to the emergency exit.

その重い扉を開けると、期待通りの外階段だった。
After opening that heavy door, I found the outside staircase I'd hoped for.

サボリで煙草を吸ってた社員風の男とばったり出くわす。
ぎろりと睨みつけると、そそくさと煙草を揉み消して姿を消す。
I bumped into a man who looked like an employee skipping work and smoking a cigarette.

After glaring at me, he quickly crushed out his cigarette and went away.

下には誰もいないように見える。…逃げ出すなら今しかない…！
It looked like there was no one below. ...If I'm gonna escape, now's my only chance...!

そう思った時、タイヤをすごい音で鳴かせながら、黒い乗用車が真下に滑り込んで急停車する。
Just when I thought that, a black car slid right under me and came to a sudden stop with an incredible squealing of the tires.

……タイヤの音から、他にも数台お仲間がいて、ここを塞ぎに１台来た、という感じだった。
...Judging by the sound of tires, it seemed they had several other allies, and that one of them had come here to block this path.

「……霞叔母さん、やるじゃない。非常口から出てくる妹にまで送迎車を送るなんて。」
"...Not bad, Aunt Kasumi. To think you'd even send a car to pick up your little sister when she's trying to get out through the emergency exit."

バンバン！と威勢良く車の扉が開き、３人の黒服が飛び出してきて、この非常階段を見上げる。
*bam*bam*! The doors of the car were forcefully opened and three black-suited men jumped out, looking up at the emergency staircase.

……いっけない、目が合った。
...Crap, our eyes met.

「１２、マル対発見。北西側非常階段３階、応援送れ。」
「縁寿さま！　そこを動かれませんように！　ご無礼を失礼します…！！」
"12, target found. Northwest side emergency stairs, third floor, send support."

"Ange-sama! Try not to move from there! Forgive our roughness...!!"

３人がどかどかと非常階段を駆け上がってくる。
The three of them began to clamor up the emergency exit.

……無礼を働くと予告済みだ。かなりまずい。
...They've already announced that they plan to be rough. This is pretty bad.

息さえしてれば、腕の一本くらい引っこ抜けても構わないくらいに命じられてるのだろう。
As long as I don't stop breathing, they've probably been ordered to grab me no matter what, even if they've gotta rip out one of my arms.

どかどかどかどか！！
彼らの重く激しい足音が螺旋になって階下から昇って来る、近付いてくる…！
*clank*clank*clank*clank*!!

Their heavy, wild footsteps became a helix and began to rise from the lower floors, getting closer...!

ビルの玄関ロビーには、黒服の護衛を７人も従えた婦人が、悠々と歩みを進めていた。
In the entrance lobby of the building, a woman with seven black-suited guards behind her advanced at a leisurely pace.

その物々しい様子に、ビルの警備員が駆けつけ、アポイントはおありでしょうかと尋ねる。
Seeing this ostentatious entrance, the security guards for the building ran up to them, asking if they had an appointment.

「………これだから東京人は。名乗らせなければ相手の格もわからない…？」
"......How typical of Tokyo people. Don't you understand the status of the person you are talking to without her having to say her name...?"

「し、失礼いたしました…。当社ではご来賓の皆様にはフロントにてセキュリ、」
"M-My apologies... At our company, guests are to take a securi-"

「……下がれ下賎が。私はお前たちの社長に呼ばれて来たんだよ。小此木鉄郎を呼んでおいで。呼びつけておいて出迎えもないとはね、これだから東京人は…。」
"...Back down, scum. I came because I was called by your president. Call Okonogi Tetsurou here. To think he would call me here and then not welcome me... How typical of Tokyo people..."

「これは失礼。ようこそ右代宮グループへ、須磨寺霞さん。」
"My apologies. Welcome to the Ushiromiya Group, Sumadera Kasumi-san."




小此木が秘書を従え、エレベーターから颯爽と現れる。
With his secretary behind him, Okonogi dashingly appeared from the elevator.

双方に不敵な笑みがありながらも、火薬の臭いを連想させる緊張感が張り詰めていた…。
Even though both of them wore bold smiles, they were wrapped in a tension reminiscent of the smell of gunpowder...

「………縁寿はどこ？　姉さんの可愛い可愛い姪を、迎えに来たのよ私は。」
"......Where is Ange? I came to greet that adorable daughter of my big sister's."

「右代宮グループでは時間厳守がモットーでしてなぁ。時間を守れない人間は契約も守れないってのが先代会長のお言葉でして。」
"Strict observance of time is our motto here at the Ushiromiya group. The former Chairman herself said that those who can't keep time can't keep contracts."

「……東京まで呼びつけて、何てザマなの？　逃がしたわね。」
"...You call me all the way to Tokyo, and this is all you have to show for it? You let her go, didn't you."

「逃げられた、と言ってもらいたいですなぁ。これでもずいぶん足止めはしたんです。さすがに気取られましてね。須磨寺さんが、時間通りに来てくれれば問題はなかったのですが。
"Please, she escaped from us. We did stall her for quite some time, but unsurprisingly, she did eventually smell a rat. Of course, this wouldn't have been a problem at all if you had arrived on time, Sumadera-san."

これだから地方人はルーズで困るんです。
"Ah, these provicials and their loose concept of time.

わっはははははははは！」
Wahhahahahahahahaha!"

「…………今何と……？　この私に何と…？」
"......What was that...? What did you say to me...?"

霧江の妹、霞の面影に霧江の気さくさはまったく感じられない。
You couldn't sense any of Kyrie's open frankness in Kasumi's face.

表情に浮かぶのは、没落した右代宮家に対する歴史ある須磨寺家の嘲りと、……にもかかわらず、右代宮家の財産を無視出来ない程度に斜陽を迎えていることを気取られたくないプライド。
She wore the arrogance of the ancient Sumadera family towards the ruined Ushiromiya family, ...as well as pride, because she didn't want anyone to notice that her family was declining so much that they couldn't ignore the Ushiromiya family's wealth.

縁寿が、この叔母を毛嫌いする理由が、一見しただけで納得できるというものだった…。
Even at a glance, it was easy to understand why Ange hated her aunt so deeply...

わずかの侮辱にも耐えられない彼女は、笑顔のまま眉を引きつらせる。
その時、後の黒服が霞に囁く。
She couldn't stand even a slight insult, and though she still smiled, her eyebrow twitched.

At that time, the black-suited man behind Kasumi whispered to her.

「縁寿さまを発見しました。対応中です。」
"Ange-sama has been found. We are currently dealing with her."

「……あら、間に合って良かった。……ありがとうね、小此木。ようやくやんちゃな姪を連れて帰れそうだわ。……私、あの子と一緒に、ゆっくりとお茶室で語らいたくてお道具まで準備して待ってたんだから。うっふふふふふふふ…！」
"...Oh, I'm glad we made it in time. ...Thank you, Okonogi. It seems I can finally take my mischievous niece home. ...I've waited so long to talk with that girl in my tea room, with all of the tools prepared. Heheheheheheh...!"

どかどかどかどか……！！
*clank*clank*clank*clank*...!!

音の暴力が螺旋を描きながら、私を階下から飲み込もうと迫ってくる。
As the violent sound drew a helix, it rushed up at me from below, threatening to swallow me up.

無論、戦っても勝ち目はない。
さりとてビル内に逃げ込んだところで、自ら袋小路に飛び込むようなものだ。
Of course, even if I fight, there's no way I'll be able to win.

And yet, running into the building would be like jumping into a dead end of my own accord.

時間と共に敵の応援は増える。
この場をどうにか出来ないなら、もう私に逃げるチャンスはない。
My enemies will increase in number with time.

If I don't do something here and now, I won't have any more chances to escape.

そして３人の屈強な黒服たちが階段下に姿を現す。
Then, three muscular black-suited men came into view below me.

１、２、３。３人だ。つまりそれは車から降りてきた全員。
1, 2, 3. Three people. In other words, everyone who had gotten out of the car.

せめて１人だったなら、出会い頭に思い切り飛び蹴りでもブチかませば、何とか出来たかもしれない。……でも、さすがに３人じゃ無理だ。
If there had been just one of them, I might've been able to dropkick them or something and smash them in the head, which might work out. ...But it really would be impossible with three of them.

いや、３か…。……３くらいなら何とかなる…。……やれる……！
Wait, ...three...? ...If there's just three, I should be able to make it... ...I can do it...!

「すぅ………。
"Take a deep breath......

…………はぁああああああ！！」
......Haaaaaaaaaaaaahh!!"

「んなッ？！　ば、馬鹿やめろ！！　危ないいいい！！　うわあああああああ…！！」
"What?! Y-You idiot, stop!! Look ooooooout!! Waaaaaaaaahhh...!!"

「０１より１２、確保したか、応答されたし。……どうした？！　応答しろ！」
"01 calling 12, is the package secure, we received a response. ...What happened?! Respond!"

「な、……何てヤツだ…、くそ……。」
"...Sh-She's crazy... Damn it..."

………つつつ…。……痛たた…。
ほらね、…何とかなったでしょ。たった３だもんね。
......Nnnggg... ...Owow...

See, ...that worked out perfectly, didn't it? There was just the three of them, after all.

もっと高いところを経験してるもの。３階くらいなら飛び降りられると思った…！
I've already tried that once from a higher place. I knew I'd be able to jump down just three floors...!

やつらが乗り付けてきた車が真下にあったのが幸いした。
快適なトランポリンとは行かないまでにも、私をそこそこにやさしく、そこそこに厳しく受け止めてくれた。
It's a good thing the car they came in was right beneath me.

Even if it wasn't as pleasant as a trampoline, it broke my fall...a little gently, a little roughly.

「……失礼しちゃうわ。ここまでへこむこともないだろうに。」
"...How rude. You didn't have to dent that much."

車の屋根は私を受け止めて、私の体に沿ってべっこりとへこみを残している。
案外、車の屋根って華奢なのね。私の体重のせいじゃないと思うわ。
The roof of the car broke my fall, leaving a massive dent around my body.

Car roofs are surprisingly delicate. I don't think it's because of my weight.

階段の上の３人は、私が飛び降りるなんて想定はなかったらしい。
出し抜かれたと知り、大慌てで階段を駆け下りてくるようだ。
Apparently, the three people on the stairs hadn't planned on me jumping down.

It seemed they now realized that they'd been outwitted, and they were rushing down the stairs.

今のうちに走って逃げなければ。
私が体を起こすと、屋根がベコンボコンと音を立てた。
I've gotta run and escape while I have the chance.

I moved my body, making clunking sounds on the car roof.

しかし、甘かった。彼らが、この場所に１人も残さずに全員が階段を駆け上るはずはなかったのだ。
But I'd been naive. Of course they wouldn't all rush up the stairs without leaving one person behind.

私を受け止めた車の運転席には黒服が１人残っていた。
扉より顔を出し、落下物の正体が私だとわかると飛び出して来る。
There was one black-suited man left in the driver's seat of the car that had broken my fall.

He stuck his head out the window, and when he realized what had fallen on him, he jumped out.

慌てて屋根から飛び降りるが、黒服の対応はあまりに素早い。……よほど私に賞金が掛かってるのか、取り逃がした際のお仕置きが苛烈なのかのどちらかだ。
In a rush, I jumped off the roof, but the black-suited man's reaction was really fast. ...Either there was a massive reward for capturing me, or there'd be some harsh punishment in store for them if they let me get away.

「１５、確保、確保…！」
"15, secured, secured...!"




「痛たたたた……！！　くっ、気安く触らないで、離してッ！！」
"Owowowow...!! Ack, don't touch me like that, let go!!"

アスファルトの上に容赦なく組み伏せられる。
私はうつ伏せに潰され、上から覆い被さるように圧し掛かられた。
I was mercilessly held down against the asphalt.

I was being crushed face-down, covered and pressed upon from above.

エレガントさの欠片もない捕まえ方だが、実に合理的で抵抗の余地はまったくない。
It was a hold without a trace of elegance, but it was extremely practical and left me no room for resistance.

私は何かの抵抗手段を求めて両手で抗おうとするが、がっちりと押さえ付けられ、自分の体をアスファルトから引き剥がすことさえ出来なかった。
I tried to push back with both hands, searching for a way to resist, but I was being pushed down solidly, and I couldn't even tear myself off the asphalt.

そこへさらに一台の車がタイヤを鳴かせながら滑り込んできて急停車する。
万事休すか。
Then another car came, squealing its tires as it slid to a sudden stop.

Is it all over now?

「ぎゃッ！！！」
"Gyah!!!"




私を押し潰していた男が鋭い悲鳴をあげる。
……私の耳の近くで叫ばれたものだから、左耳がキーンとする。一体何事？！
The man that had been crushing me let out a sharp cry.

...He was yelling straight into my ear, making my left ear ring. What in the world?!

その黒服ごと、私たちはごろんと転がされる。
Along with the black-suit guy, I fell with a *thunk*.

仰向けにされて最初に目に入ったのは、私の目の前にずいっと突き出された腕だった。
After landing face up, the first thing I saw...was an arm stuck out right in front of my eyes.

「………天草…？　あんた、どうしてここに…。」
"......Amakusa...? What are you doing here...?"

「その話は撒いてからにしましょうぜ。お嬢、車へ早く…！」
"Let's talk about that after we've lost them. To the car, quickly, lady...!"

天草は私の腕を掴むと、軽々と引き起こし、自身を重心に私をグルリと振り回す。
Amakusa grabbed my arm, easily pulled me up, spinning me around with himself as the center of gravity.

ちょっぴりだけダンスみたいと思ったのも束の間、開け放たれた運転席へ私を放り込んだ。
Just when I thought it was a little like a dance, he flung me through the open door into the driver's seat.

私はサイドブレーキを乗り越え、助手席へ潜り込む。
天草も私を押し込むようにして運転席へ乗り込んでくる。
I climbed over the hand brake and slid into the passenger's seat.

Pushing me in, Amakusa also got into the driver's seat.

四つん這い状態のままで急発進されたので、私は椅子の上でしばらくの間、引っ繰り返された亀のようにジタバタしなくてはならなかった…。
Since we suddenly accelerated while I was still on all fours, I had to kick and struggle around on the chair for a while, like a turtle that's been flipped over...

天草はバックミラーに追跡車両がないことを確認するが、わずかもスピードを落とさずに、大都会の動脈に飛び込んでいく。
Amakusa checked the rear-view mirror for cars in pursuit, but he flew into the artery of the big city without lowering his speed in the slightest.

すいすいと縫うように、次々車両を追い越していく。
まるっきり、アクション映画そのままのカーアクションだ。
We sewed our way between cars one after another.

Just like a chase scene in some action movie.

……ひどい運転に揺らされ、私はなかなか座り直すことが出来なかった。
...I was shaken by this horrible driving and had trouble sitting back down.

「お嬢、お怪我は？」
"Are you hurt, lady?"

「問題ないわ。人間って案外頑丈よ。
"I'm fine. Humans are surprisingly durable.

私、次からは降りのエレベーターを逃したら、窓から飛び降りることにするわ。」
Next time I try to a escape a downward moving elevator, I'll jump out a window instead."

「ひゃっははは、お嬢の趣味はエアダイブらしいや。ただ、次からは落下傘をつけることをお勧めしますぜ。」
"Hyahhahaha, I guess air dives are a hobby of yours, lady. Still, I'd recommend you grab a parachute next time."

「飛び降りた後に思い出せたらね。」
"Sure, if I remember to do it after leaping."

「ひゃっははははは、クールッ！」
"Hyahhahahahaha, !"

げらげら笑いながら、ハンドルを叩く。
He smacked the steering wheel, guffawing.

この軽薄そうな喋り方をする男について説明がいる？
Need an explanation for this flippantly-talking man?

彼の名は天草十三（あまくさじゅうざ）。
His name is Amakusa Juuza (天草十三).




元々は絵羽伯母さんの護衛の一人。軽口とお喋りが過ぎて伯母さんには嫌われてたっけ。
He was originally one of Aunt Eva's guards. Didn't she start to hate him because he chatted too much?

護衛たちの中では一際若いが、見掛けの軽薄さとは裏腹に、自衛隊第一空挺からフランス外人部隊をハシゴして、海外の民間軍事会社や高級警備会社に次々身を置くなど、なかなか優れたユニークな経歴を持つ。
He was much younger than the rest of the guards, but contrary to his outward flippancy, he'd hopped from the First Airborne of the JSDF to the French Foreign Legion, placing himself in overseas private military companies and high-class security companies one after another, making for a pretty incredible and unique career.

……ただ、自衛隊とフランス外人部隊はいずれも脱走だそうで、彼はフランスに入国すると逮捕されるんだとか。これもまた彼らしい軽薄なエピソードだ。
...But I heard he deserted both the JSDF and the French Foreign Legion, and that he'll be arrested if he enters France again. Both of these flippant episodes were very typical of him.

護衛たちは私に対し、余計なお喋りをしないように強く言われていたらしいが、彼はそんなのお構いなしに私にちょっかいを出してきたっけ。
The guards were sternly told not to chat with me unnecessarily, but he came and took a pass at me, didn't he?

その辺を特に嫌われて、絵羽伯母さんが死ぬ直前頃に解雇されたはずだ。
Aunt Eva was apparently particularly put off by that...and had supposedly dismissed him shortly before she died.

「ブラックウォーターでエクササイズの指導を。休暇で帰国したら小此木社長に高給を提示されまして。」

"It's been a while since I've heard that carefree tone. What happened after you got fired?"

「来週までに帰りゃ脱走にはなりませんので。話があったのは昨日です。お嬢が厄介な連中を呼び込むかもしれないと言われまして。」
「まさにその通りで申し訳ないわね。」

"Sorry that turned out to be exactly right."

"My name probably came up since I know you, and I've got lots of crazy experience. Thanks to you, it looks I'm in for a happy vacation plus some pocket money."

"He probably wants to buy some gratitude from you, lady. ...After I got fired, I was indebted to President Okonogi in various ways. He's got some dirt on me here and there, and now I can't say no to him. Hyahha!"

……で、あんたは私をどこに連れて行くつもりなの？」
...So, where are you planning on taking me?"

"Anywhere. I'm employed until the weekend. Anything after that'll cost you extra."

「一日いくら？」
"How much per day?"

「５万で手を打ちます。経費は別ですぜ。」
"I'll take 50 thousand. Plus expenses."

「軽口を叩かないなら倍払うわ。雇用期間は未定。何週間かになるかも。」
"If you stop cracking jokes, I'll double it. The period of employment isn't fixed yet. It might take several weeks."

「…そりゃ大変だ。ボスに休暇の延長を電話しねぇとなりませんぜ。」
"...That'll be tough. I'll have to call my boss to get an extension on my vacation."

「私、どうしてもあの日のことが調べたいの。」
「……あぁ、例の六軒島の？」
"More than anything, I want to investigate that day."

"...Oh, is this about Rokkenjima?"

「そうよ。１２年前にあの島で何があったのか。……私の手で、納得が行くように調べたいの。」
「そんな昔のことを今さら調べて、今さら新しい発見がありますかねぇ…？」
"Exactly. What happened on that island 12 years ago? ...I want to investigate it with my own hands to my satisfaction."

"Do you really expect to find anything new investigating something that old...?"

「そうね。だからこれは、私の自己満足のための旅なのよ。……それを終えたら、ネギでも背負って須磨寺の家に行くわ。……霞叔母さん、私にお抹茶をご馳走したいとか言ってたっけ。角材の上に正座させられて、石でも抱かされながらのお茶かしら。」

"Damn that sounds freaky, hyahhahahaha...!"

With her back still facing Okonogi, she laughed softly, but with an increasingly shrill and hateful tone, using that as a substitute for a sharp parting remark.

笑い終えると同時に、その形相は般若のように豹変するが、背を向けられた小此木にその表情が見えることはなかった。
Just as she stopped laughing, her features suddenly changed to look like a demon's,

but because her back was facing him, Okonogi couldn't see that expression.

小此木はそれを涼しげに笑いながら見送る。
その肩越しに、彼の秘書が囁きかける。
Okonogi watched her go, laughing cooly.

...Still, it looks like that guy managed it pretty well. ...All that's left is to let Ange-chan do as she pleases. I'm counting on you, Amakusa."

母上に、私にお任せをと啖呵を切ってお屋敷を出て来たんですよ？　あなた、私にさらに恥をかかせるおつもり……？　あんたらまとめて、お抹茶を振舞った方が良さそうねぇ？　……地下のお茶室は狭いから、順番待ちの行列になっちゃうかしら……？」
"When I left the mansion, I boldly told mother to leave it to me, didn't I? Do you intend to embarrass me further...? It looks like it might be better for me to serve some matcha for everyone at once, doesn't it? ...Our underground tea room is cramped, so you'll have to wait in line..."

「い、いえ…。全力で捜索します。」
"N-No... We will search with everything we have."

"...Ah, she really is a cute kid, just like Nee-san. ...Especially that way she freewheels and does as she pleases. ...Ah, now I can't see anything but Nee-san. Ah, I'm truly looking forward to it. If only I could invite Nee-san's daughter to my tea room, right...? Hohohohoho...!!"

"...The Sumadera family sure moved quickly. Did Okonogi-san sell me out...?"

"You're joking. He's my client. If he'd sold you out, he wouldn't have hired me, right...?"

"............I guess that's true."

"Him having a car waiting in the underground parking lot was just too convenient. I figured Okonogi-san sold me out. ...Though I guess by now, it's impossible to prove whether there was an ambush set up in the parking lot or not."

その地下の車って、俺のことです。」
That car in the basement...was mine."

"I freaked when the elevator came and was empty. I wonder what would've happened by now if I hadn't been listening in on their radio."

「………………つまり何？　私が素直に小此木さんを信じて、駐車場に行ってれば、私は３階から飛び降りるなんて真似、する必要もなかったってこと…？」
"......So what's going on? If I'd obediently believed Okonogi-san and gone to the parking lot, there would've been no need for me to do that jump off the third floor...?"

"Pretty much, yeah. Well, it turned out okay in the end."

「……………………。」
"............"

………何てことだろう。
......What the hell.

もしも私が小此木社長を疑わなかったなら、……窮地に陥ることもなく、のんびりと脱出できていたのだ。
If I hadn't suspected President Okonogi, ...I could've easily escaped without getting caught in a tough spot.

“小此木社長は私を売ったかもしれない”。
`President Okonogi might have sold me out'.

いや、売ったことを想定した方がいい、という疑心暗鬼が、“彼は私を売った”と仮定し~ib~決め付けた~ib~。
No, since paranoia told me that it was better to assume that he'd sold me out, I supposed and ~ib~concluded~ib~ that `He sold me out'.

彼を信じられなかったから、彼の真実にもかかわらず、私の真実は“彼が私を売った”となった……。
Because of my inability to believe in him, regardless of his truth, my truth became `He sold me out'...

小此木社長の言葉が蘇る。
I thought back on President Okonogi's words.

絶対性のない真実なんて、それを真実と呼べるのかい…？
Can you really call truth without certainty truth...?

真実なんて、愛があるかないかでいくらでも変わる。
Truth can change completely depending on whether you have love or not.

結局のところ、……真実などというものは存在しないのかもしれない。
In the end, ...perhaps truth itself doesn't exist.

それを語る人の人数分だけ、各々の解釈の真実が生み出されるだけなのだ。
There are as many interpreted truths as there are people who speak of the truth.

そんな不定形なものを真実だと認められないのなら、……私が本当に見つけたいと思う真実は、どこに存在するというのか。……そしてそれは、目で見えるものなのか。
If I can't accept something that fluid as truth, ...where does the truth that I really want to find exist? ...And is it something I'll be able to see with my eyes?

案外、…目の前にこれが真実だと突きつけられても、……私には視えないモノなのかも知れない…。
...Even if someone sticks the truth right there in front of me and says it's the truth, I might not be able to `see' it...

「……愛がなければ視えない、か。」
"...Without love, it cannot be `seen', huh?"

"...What is truth? There are as many truths as there are people. There are as many interpretations as there are people. And those can be twisted by opinions and changed indefinitely. ...Is truth really that unfixed and vague?"

「そうよ。……真実は不定形。粒子のようであり、波のようでもあり、相反する形状を同時に持つ。箱の中の猫が、生きていると思おうが死んでいると思おうが自由。……でも、真実はとても繊細。それは観測されただけで姿を変えてしまうわ。」
"That's right. ...Truth is unfixed. It can be like a particle, or like a wave, and it can hold conflicting forms at the same time. You are free to believe that the cat in the box is alive or dead. ...But the truth is very delicate. It can change its appearance just by being observed."

「シュレディンガーの猫箱とかいう話？　………寝言よ。箱を開ければ真実はわかる。開ける前の議論なんて、机上の空論もいいところ。」
"You're talking about stuff like Schrodinger's cat box? ......Nonsense. If you open the box, you learn the truth. Discussion about what happens before you open it is just an armchair theory."

「そうね。にもかかわらず、その空論を否定するには箱を開ける必要がある。……開けられない箱の中身についてのあらゆる想像は否定不能。つまりは真実ということ。」
"That's right. And yet, in order to deny that abstract theory, you need to open the box. ...It is impossible to negate any idea about the contents of a box that cannot be opened. This is what truth is."

「………真実は、否定されない限り、その形状を維持する。」
「そう。真実は、観測されない限り、その形状を維持する。」
"......As long as truth isn't denied, it keeps its form."

"That's right. As long as truth isn't observed, it keeps its form."

「つまり、暴けなきゃどんな妄言も真実たりえるわけね。」
"In other words, if it isn't exposed, any reckless statement can suffice as truth."

「えぇ。……無限の想像は、それらが互いに矛盾していたとしても否定されず同時に真実として存在できる。」
"Yes. ...Even if they contradict each other, endless ideas can exist as truth at the same time without being negated."

「………家族みんなが、六軒島の魔女に捕らわれて、永遠に１２年前に閉じ込められているという、滅茶苦茶な話すら、１２年前に何があったかわからない限り、真実として存在できる…。」
"......So even something as screwed up as my family being captured by the Rokkenjima witch and shut up 12 years ago for all eternity...can exist as truth as long as we don't know what happened 12 years ago..."

「ベアトリーチェという魔女は、１２年前の六軒島に“無限”の想像の余地を抉じ開け、そこを猫箱として全てを飲み込んだ。……開かれぬ箱の中の全ては真実。」
"This witch called Beatrice...forcibly made room for `Endless' imaginings in the Rokkenjima of 12 years ago, enveloping all of it inside a cat box. Everything inside the unopenable box is truth."

そう。
That's right.

~ib~あの島で何があったかわからないから~ib~、無限になる。
~ib~We don't know what happened on that island~ib~, so it becomes endless.

「……閉まったままならね。私が抉じ開ければいいだけの話。
"...That's assuming no one opens it up. I just have to wrench it open.

......But that box was closed up 12 years ago, and I don't even know where it is. ...Even if I visit Rokkenjima, just what can I learn about what happened 12 years ago on that desolated island?"

「さぁ。何を知ることができるのかしら。………いずれにせよそれは、１９９８年という１２年後の未来を自由に闊歩できる、最後の魔女、エンジェ・ベアトリーチェにしかできないことよ。」
"Who knows? I wonder what you could learn. ......This is something that can only be done by the person who is able to walk around freely in the world of 1998, 12 years in the future: the final witch, ANGE Beatrice."

「……………………。」
"........."

「ベアトリーチェのゲーム盤は１９８６年１０月４日から５日の２日間。つまりそれは、あなたが彼女のゲーム盤の外へ自在に動ける駒だということ。……そして、ベアトリーチェですらこのゲーム盤を超えた未来へは干渉できない。」
"Beatrice's game board lasts two days, from October 4, 1986 to the 5th. In other words, you're a piece who can move freely outside her game board. ...And even Beatrice cannot influence this future that lies outside the game board."

「……そうやって言われると、私って、かなり優秀でズルイ駒だわ。」
"...If you say it like that, it sounds like I'm a pretty overpowered piece."

「あなたが身を置く１２年後という未来は確かに遠いわ。しかし、駒は未来に位置すれば位置するほど、強い力を持つの。……言ったでしょう？　真実は、観測されると姿を変えると。」
"The future of 12 years later in which you are placed certainly is distant. However, the further a piece is placed in the future, the stronger power it holds. ...I told you, didn't I? The truth changes its appearance when it is observed."

「そう言えば、こんな話を聞いたことがあるわ。……ある日、突然、ケンタウルス座の恒星が爆発してしまっても、その爆発の光が地球に届くには、４．４光年だから４年半の月日が必要になる。」
"Come to think of it, I heard something like that once. ...Even if one day, all of a sudden, a star in the constellation Centaurus were to explode, the light from that explosion would have to cross 4.4 light years, so it would take it four and a half years to reach the Earth."

「そうね。つまり、ケンタウルスの太陽がすでになくなっているとしても、地球人は４年半の間、その事実を知覚できない。……光より早く知覚する手段は存在しないのだから。」
"That's right. In other words, even if the sun in Centaurus has already died, people on Earth won't be able to perceive that fact for four and a half years. ...Because no method of perception exists that is faster than the speed of light."

ケンタウルスの太陽の爆発を知った時。
When we learn that the sun in Centaurus has exploded...

私たち地球人は４年半前の歴史を新しい真実で塗り替える。
４年半前に爆発していたと、歴史を新しい真実で修正する。
We Earth people will paint over our history of four and a half years ago with a new truth.

We will revise history with a new fact: that it exploded four and a half years ago.

しかし、４年半を経てそれを知るまでの間、すでになくなっているにもかかわらず、ケンタウルスの太陽がまだ存在しているという誤った真実は、真実として存在できた。
However, for the four and a half year period until we learn that, despite the fact that it has already died, the mistaken truth that the sun of Centaurus still exists will be able to exist as truth.

未来の真実は、過去の真実に、勝る。
The truth of the future wins against the truth of the past.

「………そうよ。元々、六軒島の事故は、ただそれだけならば、絵羽伯母さんと右代宮家の財産を巡る陰謀疑惑でしかなかった。
"......That's right. By itself, the Rokkenjima accident gave rise to nothing but suspicion of a conspiracy involving Aunt Eva and the Ushiromiya family assets.

……しかしそれが、後年。オカルトによって脚色され、陰謀は魔女伝説として塗り替えられる。」
...But later on, ...it was dramatized and linked to the occult, and the conspiracy was painted over by the Legend of the Witch."

事件当時は陰謀として騒がれたのに、後年、それらは魔女の仕業だったとするおかしなオカルト説が蔓延し、１９８６年１０月５日の真実を塗り替え始めた…。
Even though it was clambered over as a conspiracy at the time of the crime, later on, strange occult theories, which claimed that it was the work of the witch, ran rampant and began to paint over the truth of October 5, 1986...

陰謀説は時間と共に忘れられていくだろう。
The conspiracy theories will probably be forgotten over time.

……そして、奇異で印象深い魔女説だけが、迷信的に残り続け、最後には陰謀説を、塗り潰す。
...And only the more bizarre, impressive witch theory will continue to remain as superstition, eventually covering up the conspiracies.

「そう。恒星爆発の光が地球に届くまでの間の虚偽の真実が、陰謀説という人間説だったかのよう。………数年後に漂着した手紙入りのワインボトル、『メッセージボトル』が、それをオカルト説という魔女説に遡って塗り替え始めた。
"That's right. The false truth that exists before the light from an exploding star reaches Earth is almost like the conspiracy theory, which is a human theory. ......The wine bottle with a letter in it that drifted ashore several years later, the `message bottle', painted over that theory and made things return to the occult theory, which is a witch's theory."

……そうよ。魔女なんて、１９８６年の時点では存在しなかった。その数年後に、メッセージボトルによって私たち未来の人間に“観測”されたから、魔女が六軒島を支配した…！」
"...That's right. A witch didn't exist during 1986. The witch took control of Rokkenjima because she was `observed' several years later by us humans of the future, thanks to that message bottle...!"

「……少し修正が必要よ。１９８６年の時点でも魔女は存在出来たわ。無限に存在できる数多の可能性の中のひとつとしてね。」
"...A small revision is necessary. The witch could have existed even during 1986. As one of many endless possibilities that can exist."

「確かに。観測されたら消えてしまう、猫箱の中に縮こまってね。……だからメッセージボトルは悪質なのよ。
"Certainly. She'd disappear if she were observed, so she curls up inside the cat box. ...That's what makes the message bottle so nasty."

…魔女は、箱の外に出ようとした。自らを観測させて、魔女説以外の可能性を淘汰した。……つまり、自らを否定できないように、魔女説以外の全ての可能性を否定したということ。
"...The witch tried to get out of the box. She made it so that she'd be observed, weeding out possibilities that conflicted with the witch theory. ...In other words, to make it impossible to negate her, she negated all possibilities other than the witch theory."

………何てこと。つまりベアトリーチェは、悪魔の証明を正攻法で成し遂げたのよ。そして、それは初めから魔女の計画に組み込まれていた。」
"......What the hell. So in other words, Beatrice satisfied the Devil's Proof with a frontal attack. And, that was part of the witch's plan from the beginning."

「メッセージボトルは１９８６年より未来に観測される情報ね。………ベアトリーチェにも戦人にも観測できない。…エンジェ・ベアトリーチェにしか観測できない。」
"The message bottle is information observed in the future after 1986. ......It cannot be observed by Beatrice or Battler. ...It can only be observed by ANGE Beatrice."

「……本当はメッセージボトルのことなんて調べたくなかった。…だってそれを読むことは、魔女の言い分を聞くのに同じ。魔女説なんて妄言を無視してる私には、時間の無駄でしかないと思ってた。
"...I really didn't want to investigate the message bottle. ...After all, reading that would be like listening to the witch's say. I thought the witch theory was just a crazy fantasy, so I thought of it as nothing more than a waste of time."

……でも、小此木さんに言われたわ。片方の目だけじゃ、物事を立体的に見られないって。」
"...But Okonogi-san told me. You can't see things in three dimensions with only one eye."

「魔女否定の視点と同時に、魔女肯定の視点も必要ということ？　……それは正しい考え方よ。視点の数は分母に同じ。視点の数が１では、分子である謎はわずかほども減らない。しかし、視点の数が増えれば増えるほど、謎は割り算されていく。」
"You mean that while looking at it from the viewpoint of denying witches, you must also look at it from the viewpoint of accepting witches? ...That's a correct way of thinking. The number of viewpoints is like a denominator. If you have one viewpoint, the mystery in the numerator doesn't decrease in the slightest. However, the more your number of viewpoints increases, the more the mystery begins to be divided."

「わかってるわ。……事件の数年後、近隣の島に流れ着いたメッセージボトル。それは好事家の手に渡った。アポイントは、一応取ってあるの。」
"I understand. ...There was a message bottle that washed up on a neighboring island several years after the crime. That passed into the hands of a dilettante. I made an appointment with him, just in case."

…小此木さんから、絵羽伯母さんの言い分は聞き取ることが出来た。
...I was able to hear Aunt Eva's say from Okonogi-san.

次は、魔女の言い分。
聞いてやろうじゃないの。ベアトリーチェの言い分を…！
Next up is...the witch's say.

Why don't I listen? To Beatrice's say...!

「余命３ヶ月。南條先生がそう仰ったのは去年の話よぅ？」
"3 months left to live. It was last year when you said that, right, Doctor Nanjo?"

「……わ、私は、その時の健康状態から総合的に判断してお話しているだけです。その結果、今年もたまたま、」
"...I-I only spoke of what I could comprehensively determine from his physical condition at the time. As a result, this year too, it just so happens-"

「年を越せるかも怪しいってことになってる親父殿は、今も意気軒昂でオカルト研究に没頭されてるというわけだ。それでも余命３ヶ月ってわけかい、先生？」
"So, even though it's doubtful whether Dad'll last until the end of the year, he's still totally focused on his occult research. And you still say he has only three months left, Doctor?"

「で、ですから、金蔵さんの、」
"L-Like I said, Kinzo-san's-"

「敬愛する親父殿が、未だお元気でおられるなら素晴らしいことじゃないか。親孝行なお前たちは、親父殿に挨拶がしたくてしたくて仕方がない。なので会ってもらえないので納得が行かないと、そういうわけだ。」
"Shouldn't you be happy that our respected father is still in high spirits? Out of a sense of parental respect, each one of you is so eager to greet Father. I can see how upset you are that he's unwilling to meet with you."

「…日も沈まぬ内から、遺産分配の皮算用を始める皆さんのことを思えば、お父様の会いたくないという気持ちもわかろうというものです。」
"...Considering that everyone has started aiming for the inheritance while the sun is still in the sky, I can understand why Father wouldn't want to see you."

「そ、それは誤解よ、夏妃姉さん。……ただ、私たちはその、」
"Y-You've got it wrong, Natsuhi nee-san. ...We just, umm-"

「親父とて不死身じゃねぇ、いつかは死ぬさ。死ねと言ってるんじゃない。いつかは死ぬと言ってるだけさ。それに備えての話し合いだってだけの話じゃねぇか。」
"Dad isn't immortal, and he'll die someday. We aren't telling him to die. We're just saying that he will die sooner or later. We're just talking together about how to prepare for that."

「それが不敬だと言っているのです！！」
"And that is precisely what is so disrespectful!!"

「よしなさい。また君の頭痛に障る。」
"Stop it. You'll make your headache worse."

興奮して席を立ち上がってしまった夏妃に、蔵臼は座れと制する。
Krauss told Natsuhi, who had risen from her chair in agitation, to sit down.

一気にキナ臭くなった空気を、取り繕うように秀吉が愛想笑いを浮かべ、まままま…、と全員をなだめるような仕草をする。
Trying to smooth over the atmosphere, which had suddenly become filled with suspicion, Hideyoshi put on a forced smile and motioned for everyone to calm down.

「……夏妃さん、誤解せんといてや。立つ鳥跡を濁さずっちゅう諺があるやろ？　これはその見送る側の話や。やがては必ず旅立つお父さんを、綺麗に見送るための相談なんやで。」
"...Natsuhi-san, don't misunderstand. People say you should always clean up after yourself, right? We're just talkin' about seein' him off. We're discussin' this so we can see Father off neatly when he takes off on the journey he's eventually gonna make."

「はっはっは…。さすが秀吉さんだ。同じ話をするにしても、実に知性的だ。」
"Hahaha... That's just like you, Hideyoshi-san. Even though you're saying the same thing, you make it sound so intellectual."

「えぇ、そうよ。兄さんと違ってね。」
"Yes, that's right. Unlike you, Nii-san."

「よせやい。話が進まねぇ。
"Quit it. We aren't getting anywhere.

………それでだな、兄貴。俺たちは遺産の話云々は抜きにしてもだ。たとえ親父に殴られても構わねぇ。
......So like we're saying, Aniki, forget all this about the inheritance. I don't even care if Dad hits us."

早い話が、親父に直接会って、挨拶がしてぇんだ。親父が嫌だと言ってもだ。書斎に閉じ篭ってるなら、源次さんに鍵を借りてでもな。
"To make a long story short, we wanna meet Dad directly and say hello. Even if he says he doesn't want to. If he's locked up in his study, we don't care if we have to borrow a key from Genji-san.

なぁ、楼座？」
Right, Rosa?"

「…え、…まぁその、…無理やりってわけじゃないけれど…。……だって、かなり長い間、私たちはお父様にご挨拶していない。
"...Oh, ...well, umm...it's not like we're forcing you... ...It's just...we haven't said hello to Father in such a long time.

余命わずかだと言うなら、もう二度と会えなくなる可能性だってある…。……今日がお父様と言葉が交わせるかもしれない最後の機会だし…。」
If his remaining life really is short, then there's a chance we might never be able to see him again... ...Today might be our final opportunity to exchange words with Father..."

「そうそう、楼座の言う通りよぅ。余命３ヶ月ってことは、いつ亡くなってもおかしくないってことなのよ？
"That's right, just like Rosa says. If he only has three months left, it wouldn't be odd for him to pass away any time now, right?

それなのに私たちに最後のお話をする権利さえないと言うの？　……それはいくらなんでも、あんまりな話じゃないのかしらぁ…？」
Are you saying that despite that, we don't even have the right to talk with him one last time? ...Regardless of the circumstances, isn't that just a bit too much...?"

「……あなたたちのしたい話というのが、本当に挨拶ならお父様も喜んでお会いになられるでしょう。
"...If greeting Father were truly what you wished to do, I'm sure he'd happily allow you to meet with him."

しかしお父様は皆さんがどのような不敬な話に及んでいるか、すでに聞き及んでおいでです！　お父様でなくとも、会いたい気持ちになるわけがない。お父様がお会いになられないのは他でもない、皆さん自身のせいではありませんか？」
"But Father has already heard about the disrespectful topic you hope to raise! No one would want to meet with you under those conditions. The reason you cannot meet with Father is because of your own doing and nothing else, is it not?"

「くっくっく。まったくだな。どうして親父殿がお前たちの顔を見るのも嫌か、自分の胸に手を当てずともわかるのではないかね？　親父殿は、諸君らの逼迫している経済状況も全てお見通しだ。」
"Heheh. Exactly. You shouldn't have to rack your brains to understand why Father doesn't wish to see your faces, right? Father has seen through all of your tight financial situations."

「………それ、何の話よ。…兄さんが何の話をしてるのかさっぱりだわ。」
"......What are you talking about? ...I don't have a clue what you're going on about, Nii-san."

「くっくっくくく！　私が諸君らの内情を知らないとでも思っているのかね…？」
"Heheheheh! Did you really think I didn't know about the state you're in...?"

絵羽たちは、自分たちが火の車であることを見抜かれていると気付き、最初は虚勢を張り、最後には論点を戻して反論し、金蔵に会わせろ会わせろと押し問答になった。
Eva and the rest realized that he had seen through to their current lack of funds, and alternating between bluffing and returning to the point at hand and arguing back, they repeatedly pressed Krauss to let them meet with Kinzo.

…せっかく楼座が買ってきた紅茶の良い香りは、もはや台無しだ。
...The sweet smell of the black tea Rosa had gone out of her way to buy had been completely wasted.

彼女がせめて良かったと思うことは、この場に子どもたちがいないでいてくれたことだけ。
The only thing she was glad about now was that the children weren't here for this.

……彼らが昼食後すぐに、浜辺へ遊びに行ってくれたのが唯一の救いだった。
...The fact that they'd gone to play at the beach right after lunch had been their only salvation.

絵羽は蔵臼に取っ組みかかろうとしていて、その間に秀吉と霧江が入り、双方をなだめている。
Eva made as though to tackle Krauss, and Hideyoshi and Kyrie cut in between them, trying to calm both sides.

……すると霧江が大きくため息をつきながら言った。
...Then, Kyrie took a deep breath and spoke.

「…………ごめんなさいね、蔵臼兄さん。部外者だけれど、一言いいかしら。提案があるの。」
"......I'm sorry, Krauss nii-san. I know I'm an outsider, but I wonder if you'd let me say one thing. I have a proposition."

「何だね、霧江さん。」
"What is it, Kyrie-san?"

「……まず、うちの人も含めてなんだけれど、私たちは長年、お父さんと一緒に暮らして、そのお世話をしてきた蔵臼兄さんの苦労を、あまりにも軽んじているわ。
"...First, and this includes my husband as well, for many years, we have belittled the efforts you've made by living with Father and taking care of him.

…そうでしょう？」
...Isn't that right?"

「………そりゃ、まぁ。…俺たちは外に出て気楽でいいが、何十年もお守りをしてきた兄貴は、そりゃ苦労はしたろうな。
"......That's...well... ...We've got it easy since we get to go outside, but Aniki's been babysitting Dad for decades now, and that must've been a lot of work.

……それは認めるが、それが何だってんだ、霧江。」
...I'll accept that, but what's your point, Kyrie?"

「私たちは、蔵臼兄さんがお父さんの世話人であることを認めざるを得ないのよ。……だってそうでしょう？　私たちはお父さんをずっと恐れてきて、その世話を蔵臼兄さんに押し付けてきたわ。その苦労は誰もが認めるはず。
"We must acknowledge that Krauss nii-san is Father's caretaker. ...Isn't that right? We've always feared Father...and have pushed the task of caring for him onto Krauss nii-san. Everyone should acknowledge his efforts.

ですよね？　絵羽姉さん？」
Isn't that right, Eva nee-san?"

「…………………。……だからそれが何？　兄さんがお父様の世話人？　あんた、部外者のくせに勝手なこと決めないでよ！」
".........And so what? Nii-san is Father's caretaker? Don't decide things on your own, outsider!"

「ま、…まぁまぁ。……霧江さん、あんた、何の話をしてるんだ？」
"H-Hey now, ...calm down. ...Kyrie-san, what are you talking about?"

「……………………………。……霧江、続けてくれ。」
"...............Kyrie, please continue."

「私たちは蔵臼兄さんと夏妃姉さんに、もっと感謝すべきなのよ。……いつもお父さんの世話をしてくれてありがとうって。
"We should be more grateful towards Krauss nii-san and Natsuhi nee-san. ...We should thank them for always taking care of Father.

私たちにその感謝の気持ちがないから、こんな不毛なすれ違いになるの。……そうでしょう、蔵臼兄さん。」
It's our lack of gratitude that's to blame for these wasteful conflicts we keep having. ...Isn't that right, Krauss nii-san?"

「………これは驚いたね。実の兄弟たちにも顧みられなかった私たちの苦労が、まさか霧江さんに理解してもらえるとは思わなかったよ。」
"......I'm surprised. I did not think you, Kyrie-san, would be able to understand our efforts, which even my true siblings have not stopped to consider."

「……右代宮家当主跡継ぎとして、当然の務めです。」
"...It's a natural duty for the Successor to the Ushiromiya Family Headship."

「そうね。当主跡継ぎとしての、責任よね。……お父様を世話しているからこそ、当主跡継ぎとして、私たちは認めざるを得ない。」
"That's right. It's your responsibility as the Successor to the Headship, isn't it? ...It's because you take care of Father that we must acknowledge you as the Successor."

「あんたッ！！　何を勝手に話を進めてんのよ！！　あんた部外者の分際で、」
"Hey!! Why are you bringing this up all by yourself?!! You're just an outsider-"

「待て姉貴ッ！！
"Wait, Aneki!!

………そうだな。霧江の言う通りだ。親父の世話をしているからこそ、兄貴は跡継ぎなんだ。お前の言う通りだ。」
......That's right. It's just like Kyrie says. Because you take care of Dad, you're the Successor, Aniki. It's just like you said."

「………………あ、」
"......Oh-"

「……………ん、」
"......Nn-"

楼座が気付き、それに続いて絵羽も気付く。
Rosa noticed, and then Eva did.

絵羽の、勝手に話を進める霧江に対して吼え猛る様子はぴたりとなくなり、代わって蔵臼たちを凝視するようになる。
Eva's barking demeanor towards Kyrie for advancing the discussion on her own disappeared in a flash, and she instead stared at Krauss and Natsuhi.

……夏妃はその突然の変化が理解できず、わずかにうろたえた。
...Natsuhi couldn't understand that sudden change and was slightly flustered.

「蔵臼兄さん。……ほんのいくつかの条件さえ飲んでくれれば、私たちはお父さんが亡くなるまで、二度と会わせろとは言わないわ。
"Krauss nii-san, ...if you'll accept just a few conditions, we won't ask you to let us meet Father again until he dies.

もちろん、死に目に会わせろとも言わない。……何ならお葬式にさえ欠席してもいいわ。」
Of course, we won't demand to be present at his deathbed. ...We wouldn't even mind being absent at the funeral."

「……ほぅ？　………何の話やら。だが、一応は聞こうじゃないか。その条件を言ってみたまえ。」
"...Oh? ......Where are you going with this? But I may as well listen for now. Let's hear your terms."

「一つ。……当主跡継ぎとは、現当主、右代宮金蔵の世話人を指す。」
"First. ...The term Successor to the Headship refers to the caretaker of the current Head, Ushiromiya Kinzo."

「………ふむ。それから？」
"......Hmm. And then?"

「一つ。世話人の責務は、右代宮金蔵の終生の世話をすること。……早い話が、最期を看取るまでが仕事ってことね。蔵臼兄さんには、元よりその覚悟はあるから問題はない。」
"Second. The duty of the caretaker is to look after Ushiromiya Kinzo for the rest of his life. ...To make things simple, the caretaker's job is to care for him until his final moments. You were prepared to do that from the beginning, Krauss nii-san, so that won't cause any problems."

「当然だ。そこまでの条件には何の異存もないね。元より、私が実行していることだ。」
"Naturally. I have no objections to either of those terms. I am already carrying them out."

「一つ。世話人が、万一、その監督責任を怠った場合、世話人の権利は剥奪される。」
"Third. On the off-chance that the caretaker is neglectful in his responsibilities of supervision, he shall be deprived of his rights as a caretaker."

その一言に、蔵臼の表情から余裕が消える。
…夏妃だけはまだ、その意味がわかりかねていた。
With that sentence, all slack disappeared from Krauss's face.

...Natsuhi alone was still having trouble figuring out what it meant.

「……ほぅ。世話人の監督責任とは、
……どんなものかね？」
"...Hoh. And just what are these...

responsibilities of supervision that the caretaker bears?"
